Mrs. Orfith, member of the Judith Tuanama Community Bank, lives in the region of San Martn, El Dorado province, district of San Jos de Sisa. She makes a living selling chickens whose entrails have already been removed. Her business is situated in the local market, where she has a regular stand and where large quantities of clients frequent daily. She also sells to neighborhood women who sell food and to grocery stores around the city. With this loan of S/.2,200, which she will repay in six installments, she hopes to buy large quantities of chickens to slaughter as necessary to provide for her clients. She also hopes to buy livestock, which she will raise and sell when necessary. Mrs. Orfith is an enthusiastic woman of 28 years of age. She is happy to be given the possibility of reaching her proposed objectives. Her ultimate goal is to further expand her business and to see her children enter a profession.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Wholesale purchasing of chicken.

location.town: San Jos de Sisa - San Martin

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To increase the capital for her work

loan.name: Rolith

texts.es:
La seora Rolith, socia del Banco Comunal Judith Tuanama, vive en el Departamento de San Martn, Provincia de El Dorado, Distrito de San Jos de sisa. Rolith es estilista y cosmetloga, tiene un saln de belleza en donde tambin vende productos de belleza. El saln est ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Nereo Cabello C-06, en donde espera a sus clientes para atender con mucha amabilidad sus gustos en cortes, tientes y tratamientos de belleza.
Con este crdito de S/. 2,000, el cual ser cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprar productos de belleza en oferta como perfumes para damas, caballeros y nios, desodorante, joyas, esmalte, lociones, adems implementar el saln con tintes, tijeras y productos para tratamiento de rostro.
Rolith tiene 40 aos de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos quienes todava dependen de ella. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer decidida, trabajadora y buena administradora. Su meta es comprar un andamio para ampliar su negocio con la venta de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rolith, member of the Judith Tuanama Community Bank, lives in the region of San Martn, El Dorado province, district of San Jos de Sisa. Mrs. Rolith is a hair stylist and makeup artist. She owns her own beauty salon where she also sells beauty products. The salon is located in her home at Jr. Nereo Cabello C-06, where she attends her clients wishes, providing haircuts, dye jobs, and beauty treatments. With this loan of S/.2,000, which she will repay in six payments, she hopes to buy beauty products such as perfumes for women, men, and children, deodorants, jewelry, nail polish, and lotions. Also, she hopes to replenish her salon with new hair dyes, scissors, and face treatments. Mrs. Rolith is 40 years of age. She lives with her husband and three children whom are still dependent on her. She has always prided herself on being a hardworking and dedicated businesswoman. Her ultimate goal is to buy shelves to expand her business with the sale of groceries.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchasing beauty products, hair dyes, scissors, and face treatments.

location.town: San Jos de Sisa - San Martin

loan.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 42 aos, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Trabaja diariamente cuidando de ovejas, para luego vender su carne, tambin cra cuyes, pero en menor proporcin, lleva a pastear a sus ovejas a espacios abiertos durante casi todo el da, y cerca al anochecer los regresa a su establo. Cuando sus animales estn listos, planifica la distribucin de la carne en varios lugares, como carniceras y bodegas cercanas a su casa.Es ms rentable comprar los animales vivos y vender su carne, que slo comprar la carne al por mayor para distribuirla.Lidia disfruta de esta actividad porque le gustan los animales y le permite vivir tranquila. Solicita este prstamo porque desea comprar ms animales para hacerlos engordar, adems para invertir en sus tierras y mejorar sus cultivos de pasto.
texts.en:
Lidia is 42 years old and she lives with her husband and 3 children. She works every day taking care of sheep in order to later sell their meat. During the day, she takes these sheep out to the field so they can feed themselves. When her animals are ready, she sells their meat to butcher shops and warehouses close to home. It is more productive to buy the animals alive and then sell their meat, than just buy their meat in large amounts in order to distribute them. Lidia enjoys this activity because she likes animals and because it gives her tranquility. She requests this loan because she would like to invest in the purchase of more animals and make them fatter. She also wants to invest in the land and in improving the quality of the grass from which her animals feed themselves. She also raises cuyes in smaller proportions,

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Increase the amount of animals that she currently has and improve the quality of the grass from which these animals feed themselves

loan.name: Rosa Llane

texts.es:
La seora Rosa, socia del Banco Comunal Las Orqudeas, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martn, Distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. El negocio est ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Per N 935. Los clientes son sus amigos, padres del aula de sus hijos, vecinos de su barrio y familiares. Trabaja con pedidos.
Con este crdito de S/.1,500, el cual ser cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprar productos de belleza en oferta como perfumes para damas, caballeros y nios, desodorante, joyas, esmalte, lociones, etc., para surtir el negocio y pueda tener mayor ganancia y volver a invertir nuevamente.
Rosa tiene 36 aos de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos quienes todava dependen de ella. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer decidida, trabajadora y buena administradora. Su meta es ampliar el negocio y seguir creciendo en esta actividad, adems de llegar a ser una promotora estrella.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa, member of Las Orqudeas Community Bank, lives in the department and province of San Martn, in the Tarapoto District. She sells beauty products. The business is run out of her own house at Jr. Per, No. 935. Her clients are her friends, the parents of her childrens classmates, neighbors, and relatives. She takes orders. With a loan of S/.1,500, to be paid in six installments, she will buy beauty products on special offer such as perfume for women, men, and children, deodorant, jewelry, nail polish, lotion, etc., in order to supply her business, increase her profits, and reinvest. Rosa is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two children, whom still depend on her. She has always stood out for being determined, hardworking, and a good manager. Her goal is to expand her business and to continue growing in this activity, as well as become a star promoter for her business.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchasing beauty products

loan.name: Susan Magali

texts.es:
La seorita Susan Magaly, socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Rumbo al Desarrollo, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martn, Distrito de Morales. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y lencera por catlogos. El negocio est ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Augusto B. Leguia N 159. Los clientes son sus amigos, compaeros de trabajo, vecinos de su barrio y familiares. Trabaja con pedidos.
Con este crdito de S/.800, el cual cancelar en 4 cuotas, comprar productos de belleza en oferta como perfume para damas, caballeros y nios, desodorante, joyas, esmalte, lociones, etc., para surtir el negocio y pueda tener mayor ganancia y volver a invertir nuevamente.
Susan tiene 21 aos de edad, es soltera, y a pesar de su corta edad es muy decidida y trabajadora. Su meta es comprar una vitrina para exhibir sus productos, llegar a tener una boutique y terminar la carrera de Derecho.
texts.en:
Miss Susan Magaly, a member of the Mujeres Rumbo al Desarrollo Communal Bank, lives in the department and province of San Martn, in the Morales District. She sells beauty products and lingerie through catalogues. She runs the business out of her own house, No. 159 on Jr. Augusto B. Leguia. The clients are her friends, coworkers, neighbors, and relatives. She takes orders. With this loan of S/.800, to be paid off in four installments, she will buy beauty products like perfume for women, men, and children, deodorant, jewelry, nail polish, lotion, etc., so she can supply her business, increase her profit, and reinvest. Susan is 21 years old, single, and despite her young age is very determined and hard-working. Her goal is to buy a display cabinet for her products, get a boutique, and finish her Law degree. .

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchasing beauty products

loan.name: Teresa Lilia

texts.es:
La seora Teresa Lili pertenece al Banco Comunal Picota, vive en la Regin San Martn, provincia y distrito de Picota. Se dedica a la venta de comida tipo men, actividad que lo realiza en el puesto de venta que est ubicado en el mercado de su localidad, lugar donde acuden diariamente los comensales, los cuales son moradores de su barrio y visitantes de otros lugares. No le faltan clientes por su buena sazn, variedad de los platos que oferta y la atencin que brinda a los clientes.
Con este crdito de S/.1,000, el cual ser cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprar arroz, azcar en saco, aceite en galn y otros ingredientes que necesita para la preparacin diaria de los platos que oferta a los clientes como verduras, carnes (res, cerdo, pollo, pescado), tambin invertir en el arreglo de su casa para acondicionar el negocio ms adelante.
La seora Teresa tiene 34 aos de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo, quien es su motor para seguir luchando y trabajando da a da. Es una mujer decidida, tiene como meta tener un restaurante en su propio domicilio para atender a los clientes con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Ms. Teresa Lilia A. belongs to the Picota Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martn region, in the provincial district of Picota. She dedicates herself to the sale of menu-type food, selling from her stand in the local market. People from the neighborhood and visitors from nearby communities go to the local market daily to eat. Ms. A. attracts many clients because of the good seasoning she uses on her food, the variety of dishes on the menu, and the good restaurant service she provides for her customers. With this loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles to be repaid in 6 installments, she will buy rice, sacked sugar, several gallons of cooking oil, and other necessary ingredients for the daily preparation of the vegetarian, beef, pork, chicken, and fish dishes she offers on the menu. She is also investing in home improvements in order to prepare her business for the future. Mrs. A., 34, is a single mother who lives with her son, who gives her strength to keep fighting and working every day. She is very determined, and her goal is to open a restaurant in her home that better attends to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loan.name: Betty

texts.es: Hace ms de 20 aos, Betty (39), viene dedicndose a la venta de variedad de golosinas y bebidas gaseosas en uno de los terminales de transporte terrestre interprovinciales de la ciudad de Juliaca, con ese pequeo negocio logr brindarle bienestar a su familia, pero ahora que sus hijos se encuentran siguiendo sus estudios superiores le demandan mayor gasto econmico, es por ello que decidi dedicarse a la venta de boletos de viaje, obteniendo ingresos econmicos extras por cada pasaje que vende.Su deseo es adquirir variedad de galletas y chocolates de la ciudad de Tacna y distribuirlos al por mayor a los comerciantes de la ciudad de Juliaca, con esos ingresos que obtenga lograr cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
For more than 20 years Betty (39) has been selling a variety of candy and soft drinks for a living at one the the interprovincial ground transportation terminals of the town of Juliaca. With this small business she was able to offer well-being to her family, but now when her children are going on with higher education the economic costs have increased and therefore she decided to sell travel tickets to obtain some extra income. It is her wish to purchase a variety of cookies and chocolate bars at the town of Tacna in distribute in bulk to the storekeepers in the town of Juliaca and thus obtain earnings to cover her needs.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Increase stock of cookies and candies to improve business.

loan.name: Justo

texts.es: Justo es un ejemplar y respetable padre y esposo, hace algunos aos estuvo dedicado a la venta de ropa, pero conforma iba obteniendo ganancias con esta actividad alquil un local e implement poco a poco su pequeo restaurante, actualmente su local est ubicado en una zona de mucha concurrencia, por lo que la demanda de sus deliciosos potajes va en aumento, el ingreso que percibe por esta actividad le ayuda a la manutencin de su familia, constituida por su esposa y una hija.El deseo de Justo, y por lo que solicita este prstamo, es ampliar su restaurante, para ms adelante ahorrar lo suficiente y comprar un motocarro, para que en sus horas libres pueda brindar servicio de transporte a la poblacin.
texts.en:
Justo is a respectable and exemplary husband and father. Several years ago he used to sell clothing, but as he saved his earnings from that business he was able to rent a space which he eventually turned into a small restaurant. His restuarant is located in a very busy area, so demand for his delicious vegetable stew is growing. The income he earns from his restaurant helps Justo support his wife and daughter. Justo is requesting this loan so that he can expand his restaurant. He hopes to save enough to eventually buy a motorcycle taxi so that he can provide transportation in his free time.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Expand and improve restaurant

loan.name: Higinia

texts.es: Las salteas que prepara Higinia con apoyo D. sus hijos son muy demandadas en la ciudad D. Juliaca, esta familia inicia con la preparacin D. sus ricas salteas (empanadas rellenas con carne y pollo) desD. las 3:00 D. la madrugada hasta las 9:00 D. la maana, luego las distribuyen en los diferentes snacks, y puestos, y quioscos D. los centros educativos.Esta dedicada madre se siente muy satisfecha con esta actividad, porque en muy corto tiempo viene obteniendo muy buenas ganancias, permitindole as brindarles una buena educacin a sus 2 hijos, quienes en sus horas libres la apoyan alegremente en esta actividad, al mismo tiempo la llenan D. dicha y orgullo porque responden favorablemente en sus estudios.En esta oportunidad, requiere D. un prstamo, dinero que ser invertido en la compra D. insumos para la preparacin D. sus agradables salteas.
texts.en:
The salteas (pastries filled with meat, vegetables and spicy sauce) that Higinia prepares with the help of her children are in demand in the city of Juliaca. This family works in the preparation of the delicious salteas (filled with beef and chicken) from 3:00 a.m. to 9:00 a.m. then, they are distributed in different snack stores, stands, and in educational centers. This dedicated mom feels fulfilled with this activity because in a very short period of time she has obtained good profit, which has allowed her to proviD. a good education to her two children, who help her with this activity in their free time, they also make her proud and happy because they are good students. At this time, she requires a loan, which will be invested in the purchase of ingredients to prepare salteas.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare delicacies

loan.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, como toda madre preocupada por el bienestar y educacin de sus hijos, trata de desenvolverse en diferentes actividades para generar ingresos econmicos y as ofrecerle educacin a su hijo Darwin de 18 aos.Su deseo ms grande a es ver a su hijo con una profesin y un futuro promisorio, por esa razn, decidi trabajar en una prestigiosa farmacia de la ciudad de Juliaca, sus conocimientos sobre medicamentos, su disponibilidad y buena la atencin que brinda, hacen incrementar la cantidad de clientes.Adicionalmente a esta labor, se dedica a la artesana, generando de esa manera ingresos extras para la tranquilidad y estabilidad de su hogar.En esta oportunidad, requiere obtener un prstamo, para poder inscribir a su hijo en una academia pre universitaria, con el fin de que reciba una buena preparacin para que postule y logre ingresar a la universidad.
texts.en:
Yolanda, just like any mother concerned with the education of her children, works in different areas in order to produce some revenue and offer a education to Darwin, her 18 year old son. Her dream is to see her child as a professional and with a promising future. Because of this reason, she decided to work in a prestigious pharmacy in the city of Juliaca. Her knowledge of medicaments and her demeanor help increase the amount of clients that visit her. In addition to this job, she also works as a handcraft, generating in this way the extra revenue for the tranquility and stability of her home. In this opportunity, she requests a loan to sign up her son in a preparatory academy so that he is prepared to go to college when he graduates.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Inscribir a su hijo en una academia pre universitaria. / Incribe her son in a pre-college academy.

loan.name: Ninfa

texts.es: Ninfa, a su corta edad (22) sufri la penosa perdida de su esposo Fredy de 23 aos de edad, con quien tena muchos planes y proyectos en la vida, desde entonces, trata de sobre llevar este episodio y salir adelante junto a su pequeo nio, quien la motiva a cumplir con los sueos y proyectos que algn da tuvo con su compaero.Esta joven madre pone su mejor esfuerzo y creatividad en cada una de las prendas que teje, gracias a eso, tiene gran cantidad de solicitudes, por ello recurre a este prstamo, dinero que ser invertido en adquirir variedad de lana, para seguir tejiendo sus prendas y cumplir satisfactoriamente con los pedidos de sus exigentes clientes.
texts.en:
Ninfa, a su corta edad (22) sufri la penosa perdida de su esposo Fredy de 23 aos de edad, con quien tena muchos planes y proyectos en la vida, desde entonces, trata de sobre llevar este episodio y salir adelante junto a su pequeo nio, quien la motiva a cumplir con los sueos y proyectos que algn da tuvo con su compaero.Esta joven madre pone su mejor esfuerzo y creatividad en cada una de las prendas que teje, gracias a eso, tiene gran cantidad de solicitudes, por ello recurre a este prstamo, dinero que ser invertido en adquirir variedad de lana, para seguir tejiendo sus prendas y cumplir satisfactoriamente con los pedidos de sus exigentes clientes.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of wool so she can sew in order to be able to meet the demand of her clients.

loan.name: Rosa

texts.es: La venta de queso es el sustento principal de Rosa, joven empeosa de 23 aos de edad, con muchsimas ganas de prosperar en la vida, se viene dedicando a este oficio desde hace 2 aos, empez apoyando a sus hermanos mayores, pero al aprender rpidamente, decidi hacer de este oficio, su principal ingreso econmico.Adquiere su mercadera los fines de semana en los diferentes pueblitos aledaos de la ciudad donde vive, Juliaca, para luego enviarlas al por mayor al mercado de la ciudad de Arequipa, donde tiene gran clientela asegurada.Esta actividad de compra y venta de queso le est permitiendo cubrir satisfactoriamente sus estudios de contabilidad, ahora, el deseo que tiene esta joven es contar con mayor capital para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
The sale of cheese is the main source of income of Rosa, a young and hardworking 23-year-old woman with a lot of dreams for her future. She started working in this business two years ago, when she began supporting her older brothers. As she learned more, she decided making this activity her principal source of revenue. During the weekends she buys the cheese in different small towns around Juliaca, in order to sell large quantities of this product to the city of Arequipa, where the demand for cheese is large. This selling and buying of cheese has allowed her to cover the costs of studying accounting; now, the dream of this young woman is to invest in her business and see it grow.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Invest in her business of selling cheese

loan.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia es una amorosa y abnegada madre de 4 hijos, est dedicada al negocio de venta de productos por campaa y al tejido de enaguas, estas actividades, las desempea habidamente, con lo que puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. Ahora, tiene pensado comprar nueva y variada mercadera y materiales para su confeccin de enaguas, por lo que solicita este prstamo, Silvia cree que con este negocio y el trabajo que realiza su esposo, brindando servicio de movilidad urbana en su triciclo, mejorarn sus ingresos econmicos y la calidad de vida de sus 4 menores hijos.
texts.en:
Silvia is the loving and self-sacrificing mother of four. She works selling seasonal products and weaving traditional Peruvian petticoats. She engages in these activities regularly in order to help her husband with household expenses. Currently, she intends to buy new and varied merchandise as well as materials to make her petticoats; this is why she is seeking a loan. Silvia believes that, with this business and with her husband's work in urban transportation services, they will have more income and will thereby be able to improve their four young children's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of new merchandise and materials for making petticoats.

loan.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge Alberto es un comerciante de 33 aos de edad del Rancho La Reforma, comunidad localizada en Montemorelos Nuevo Len.

Jorge Alberto inic su negocio hace 5 aos, en un principio se dedic a la venta de pacas para ganado, es importante sealar que su surgimiento como microempresario se dio derivado de la necesidad por autoemplearse y contar con una fuente de ingresos para atender las necesidades de su familia. La familia de Jorge Alberto se compone por su esposa e hija de 6 aos de edad.

Actualmente, solicita un prstamo por US $350 a un plazo de 4 meses para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes, lo cual ayudara a contar con un mayor surtido en su negocios. Los invito a que apoyemos a Jorge Alberto y as ayudemos a las actividades del campo mexicano!
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto is a 33-year-old merchant from the ranch La Reforma, a community in Montemorelos Nuevo Len. He currently asks for a 320 USD loan for four months for the purchase of seeds and fertilizers, a purchase that would allow him to diversify his businesses. Jorge Alberto began working here five years ago; he began selling a rodent called a paca in the livestock market, He lives with his wife and his 6 year old daughter. I invite you to support Jorge Alberto and thus help the activities of Mexican agriculture!

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Compra de semillas y fertilizante

loan.name: Ni Putu Yeni Kiswanti

texts.id: Putu Yeni adalah seorang ibu muda yang tinggal di desa Manistutu yang jauh dari keramaian kota. Putu hidup bersama dengan suami dan anaknya yang berumur 6 tahun. Putu menekuni usaha ternak babi karena harus membantu penghasilan suaminya yang seorang petani dimana memang dirasakan tidak cukup memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga di jaman sekarang ini. Dalam menekuni usahanya Putu tergabung di kelompok ternak babi Kembang Mekar. Pinjaman pertama ke DINARI memberi pengaruh yang sangat bagus untuk perkembangan usaha ternak babinya. Untuk jangka waktu pemeliharaan 5 bulan Putu Yeni bisa mendapat keuntungan sampai Rp.500.000,-. Karena itulah Putu Yeni melanjutkan kerja sama dengan DINARI melalui pinjaman yang kedua. Pinjaman berjangka waktu 6 bukan ini akan digunakannya untuk menambah populasi ternak babinya dengan membeli 3 ekor bibit penggemukan disamping induk babi yang sudah dimilikinya. Dan sisa dari pembelian bibit akan digunakan untuk membeli pakan ternak. Diharapkan dengan bertambahnya jumlah peliharaan serta pinjaman yang semakin meningkat maka bisa dimanfaatkan untuk membeli pakan yang lebih berkualitas sehingga akan menghasilkan panen yang lebih baik dari sebelumnya dan pada akhir periode nanti bisa mengembalikan pinjaman dari DINARI. Program DINARI secara ekonomi memang memberi dampak yang baik bagi keluarga Putu Yeni.
texts.en:
Putu Yeni is a young housewife lives in Manistutu village, away from a crowd of a city.putu lives with her husband and their 6 years old son. She is running a pig breeding business to help her husband, a farmer with low income, in fulfilling their familys daily needs. Putu Yeni is a member of Kembang Mekar, a group of pig breeders. The first loan earned from DINARI gave a good impact that in 5 months, Putu Yeni was able to earn up to Rp 500,000 income. That is why she proposed to earn the second loan. The proposed loan will be a 6 months period loan with repayment on the end of the period. Putu Yeni will use the loan to purchase 3 more piglets; the rest will be used to purchase fodder. She hopes by the increase of the number of the piglets and the more capital she manages, she will be able to earn more. DINARI program really gives a good impact for Putu Yeniss economic condition.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana Dyah Kuntari, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase piglets and fodder

loan.name: Ni Nengah Sibu

texts.id: Meskipun sudah berusia lanjut tetapi Nengah Sibu tetap ulet berusaha meningkatkan usaha ternak babinya. Tergabung dalam kelompok ternak Kembang Mekar, Nengah sekarang hanya memelihara babi penggemukan saja tanpa induk tetapi hasil yang dicapai cukup lumayan. Sehingga bisa membantu suaminya yang seorang petani dengan penghasilan yang pas-pasan dalam memenuhi kebutuhan ekonomi keluarga serta mampu menyekolahkan seorang anaknya sampai bangku kuliah. Pinjaman pertama ke DINARI memberikan keuntungan yang lumayan bagus yaitu Rp.400.000,- selama 5 bulan pemeliharaan. Sekarang dengan pinjaman kedua yang berjangka waktu 6 bulan ini Nengah Sibu mencoba menambah babi peliharaannya sebab dari perhitungannya akan memberikan keuntungan yang lebih baik lagi. Dan ditambah lagi dengan pembinaan dari staf DINARI pastinya usaha Nengah Sibu akan tambah maju. Untuk pembayaran pinjaman kembali ke DINARI akan dilakukan pada bulan ke 6 diakhir periode pinjaman. Ternak babi inilah salah satu yang diharapkan Nengah Sibu dapat menolong ekonomi keluarganya. Keuntungan yang didapat sangat berguna bagi pencukupan kebutuhan sehari-hari terutama untuk kuliah anaknya.
texts.en:
Eventhough Nengah Sibu has been quite old; she is still passionate in running her pig breeding business. Being a member of Kembang Mekar group, Nengah only raises piglets but is able to earn good income that helps her husband, a farmer with a low income, to afford their family needs as well as to support their children in pursuing college degree. First loan earned from DINARI gave her a good income, i.e. Rp 400,000,- for 5 months period. The current proposed loan is a 6 months loan that is aimed to purchase more piglets in order to get higher income. The repayment will be done at the end of loan period. Nengah is confident that her business will be getting better, especially with capacity buildings given by DINARI staffs to improve the business.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana Dyah Kuntari, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase piglets and fodder

loan.name: Ni Ketut Astuti

texts.id: Keseharian Ketut Astuti memang bekerja di ladang bersama suaminya yang ternyata hasil dari mengolah ladangnya itu tidaklah bisa sepenuhnya mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya. Akhirnya untuk lebih meningkatkan perekonomian keluarga, Ketut Astuti memilih untuk mengambil usaha ternak babi dan ikut di kelompok ternak Kembang Mekar untuk mendukung pekerjaan suaminya. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp. 800.000,-, Ketut membeli induk babi dan kemudian ditambah dengan pinjaman dari DINARI periode I mampu menambah modalnya yang kemudian dibelikan 4 ekor babi penggemukan. Setelah 5 bulan, hasil yang didapat sangat bagus dengan keuntungan mencapai Rp. 1000.000,- setelah dipotong biaya pakannya. Selanjutnya dengan pinjaman periode II dengan jangka waktu yang sama yaitu 6 bulan ini Ketut berencana akan membeli induk babi satu lagi untuk bisa menghasilkan lebih banyak bibit yang bisa dijual. Pengembalian pinjaman akan dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjaman setelah pemeliharaan selama sekitar 6 bulan. Program DINARI yang menjangkau para peternak babi ini sangat membantu Ketut dalam menekuni usahanya sebagai peternak babi. Keuntungan yang dihasilkan juga sangat membantu dalam memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga serta membiayai keperluan sekolah anaknya.
texts.en:
Everyday, Ketut Astuti helps her husband working on farming field. The income they get from cultivating the farm unfortunately is not too big that could not fulfill all their daily needs. Finaly, to increase the familys economic condition, Ketut Astuti chose to breed pigs and joined Kembang Mekar, a group of pig breeders. She started the business with Rp 800,000,- as the initial outlay and deployed the capital to purchase a pig. Then Ketut Astuti earned additional capital from DINARI and used it to purchase another 4 piglets. After 5 months, she was able to earn Rp 1,000,000 net income. Ketut Astuti plans to use the loan proposed from DINARI to purchase another pig to breed more piglets that can be sold. The proposed loan is a 6 months loan, with the repayment will be done on the end of the loan period. DINARI program for pig breeders really helped Ketut Astuti in running her pig breeder business. The income she earns is helping her to fulfill the familys needs and to support her children education funds.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana Dyah Kuntari, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase piglets and fodder

loan.name: Ni Ketut Noli

texts.id: Hidup di desa dengan pekerjaan sehari-hari sebagai petani yang mengolah ladang bersama suaminya dengan penghasilan yang tidak menentu membuat Ketut Noli sekeluarga hidup dalam kesederhanaan. Usaha ternak babi yang juga ditekuninya pun tidak terlalu banyak membantu karena kurangnya modal untuk mengembangkan usaha ternaknya. Setelah mendapat penjelasan tentang program DINARI melalui staf pembina maka Ketut yang kemudian masuk dalam kelompok ternak Kembang Mekar mencoba peruntungan dengan meminjam modal ke DINARI. Pinjaman pertama berjalan dengan lancar setelah dibelikannya 4 ekor babi penggemukan dan melalui pemeliharaan selama 5 bulan serta tambahan training dari staf DINARI, penjualan babi Ketut Noli berhasil meraup keuntungan Rp. 200.000,- per bulannya. Hasil menguntungkan ini mendorong Ketut untuk melanjutkan ke pinjaman kedua dengan jangka waktu selama 6 bulan yang langsung dibelikannya bibit induk babi dengan harapan nantinya akan menghasilkan anak-anak babi yang bisa dijual. Sisanya digunakan untuk membeli pakan babi. Keuntungan dari pinjaman pertama membuat Ketut Noli semakin bersemangat menekuni usaha ternak babinya disamping masih rutin ke ladang setiap harinya. Adapun untuk pengembalian pinjaman akan dihitung pada akhir periode pinjaman. Dengan hasil ini Ketut mampu membiayai kebutuhan anaknya yang masih sekolah kelas 2 SMA serta mencukupi keperluan rumah tangga sehari-hari.
texts.en:
Ketut Noli is a farmer that works her family owned field with her husband. Her uncertain farming income makes her live frugally. Her pig farm did not help much in supplementing her income due to insufficient funding to develop the farm. After getting introduced to DINARI and obtained additional training, Ketut joined Kembang Mekar farming group. She also sought funding help from DINARI. She used her first loan to purchase 4 fattening pig. After 5 months, she sold those pigs for $20 profit per month. This result compelled her to seek second loan with 6 months tenor to be used to purchase piglets to be grown and sold later. The rest of the money will be used to purchase feeds. Hopefully from the increased profit, she can pay for her child who is in junior yr in high school and pay her daily living expenses.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase Piglets and Feeds

loan.name: Yang

texts.en:
Mrs. Yang S. is a villager in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. She is a 34-year-old widow with a child who is attending school. She is a tailor who makes clothes in the local village.

In her business, Mrs. Yang S. now faces a small problem because her sewing machine is too old and cannot produce a good product for her consumers so she has decided to ask for a loan to purchase a new sewing machine in order to make a good product for her customers.

loan.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loan.name: Soth

texts.en:
Mrs. Soth S. was born in 1959 and she now lives in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. She is a vegetable seller and her husband, Mr. Phen Phat, is a motorbike taxi driver who earns only a meager income to support his family.
In Mrs. Soth S.'s plantation, she now faces an infertile soil which has made her crop output decline. Thus, Mrs. Soth S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizers to support her crops. She would use the rest of the loan to buy more pesticides to kill insects.
Mrs. Soth S. has four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the three remaining are attending school. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizers to support her crops

loan.name: Ni Ketut Sitri

texts.id: Sebagai seorang ibu rumah tangga Ketut Sitri tergolong wanita yang ulet. Selain membantu suaminya Wayan Lungguh bekerja sebagai petani, Ketut Sitri juga memelihara babi di belakang rumahnya. Setelah bergabung di kelompok Kembang Mekar dan mengajukan pinjaman pertama ke DINARI, Ketut membeli satu ekor induk babi disamping 3 ekor bibit penggemukan yang sudah dimilikinya. Selain itu sisa pinjaman juga digunakan untuk membeli pakan babi. Setelah 5 bulan dipelihara Ketut menjual anak-anak babi dari induk peliharaanya dan berhasil mendapatkan keuntungan sebesar Rp. 200.000,- per bulannya. Itu belum termasuk keuntungan dari penjualan 3 ekor babi penggemukan modalnya sendiri. Selanjutnya pada pinjaman kedua dengan jangka waktu sama yaitu 6 bulan, Ketut akan menambah 4 ekor bibit penggemukan dan tetap memelihara induknya juga. Nantinya dengan penambahan populasi babi ini akan diperoleh hasil yang lebih bagus lagi dari sebelumnya sehingga pinjaman DINARI juga bisa dikembalikan pada akhir periode pinjaman dan bisa segera dilanjutkan lagi dengan pinjaman selanjutnya. Karena hasil dari beternak babi ini sangat menjanjikan bagi Ketut Sitri dalam meningkatkan perekonomian keluarganya.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Sitri is a very diligent housewife. Besides helping her husband, Wayan Lungguh farming, Ketut Sitri also owns a pig farm in her backyard. Fater joining Kembang Mekar group and sought first loan from DINARI, Ketut bought a pig. She previously has farmed 3 pigs. The loan was also used to buy feeds. After 5 months, the matured and fattened pigs were sold for $20 net profit per months. She is seeking second loan with 6 month tenor to purchase 4 piglets. Hopefully with these additional pigs, she cna earn more profit to pay back the loan and bring additional profitt to help her family's finances.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase Piglets and Feeds

loan.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Em C. lives in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province and she is a vegetable farmer. Since her field is far from irrigation and she cannot generate water to support her field, Mrs. Em C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump for this purpose and she hopes to produce a better crop to sell.

Her husband, Mr. Sam Yorng, assists his wife in the field. Mrs. Em C. is 68 years old and the mother of three children who are all married and they usually give some money to support their parents because they are too old. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loan.use: to buy a pump to water her field

loan.name: Ni Komang Wenti

texts.id: Memiliki 3 orang putri yang 2 diantaranya sudah duduk di bangku sekolah tentu sangat membebani keuangan keluarga Komang Wenti yang sudah pas-pasan. Disamping juga harus mencukupi kebutuhan lainnya. Suaminya yang hanya seorang petani dengan hasil yang tidak terlalu banyak membuat Komang harus ikut berusaha mendukung ekonomi keluarga. Untuk itulah Komang berusaha dengan memelihara babi di rumahnya dan masuk anggota kelompok ternak Kembang Mekar. Dengan modal sendiri serta pinjaman dari DINARI, Komang mampu membeli 3 ekor induk babi dimana setelah 6 bulan memelihara induk babi tersebut menghasilkan masing-masing 5-6 ekor anak babi. Setelah dijual keuntungan yang diperoleh setelah dipotong biaya pakannya mencapai Rp. 1.500.000,- dalam kurun waktu 6 bulan. Melihat hasil yang bagus ini, Komang melanjutkan ke pinjaman kedua dengan jangka waktu 6 bulan juga dan rencananya akan dibelikan pakan yang lebih berkualitas bagi 3 ekor induk babinya tersebut sehingga anak-anak babi yang dihasilkan akan bertambah banyak dan berkualitas bagus. Program pinjaman ke peternak babi dari DINARI dengan pelunasan pinjaman pada akhir periode di bulan ke 6 ini dirasakan sangat menolong Komang Wenti untuk mengembangkan usahanya dan hasilnya sangat membantu Komang untuk menyekolahkan anak-anaknya.
texts.en:
Komang Wenti needs to afford tuition for her 3 daughters, two are in school already. She also needs to pay for her daily living expenses. Her husband is a farmer with uncertain and limited income. Komang is compelled to help her family's finances by farming pigs in her backyard. With her own money and additional loan from DINARI, Komang managed to purchase 3 breeding pigs. After 6 months, they produced 6 piglets that was sold for $150 profit in 6 months. After this encouraging result, she was encouraged to seek second loan from DINARI that she will use to purchase higher quality feeds for her 3 breeders, so they produce higher quality piglets. She feels that DINARI's flexible loan structure helps tremendously in developing her business. She plans to use the additional profit to pay her daughters' tuition.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase Feeds

loan.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng L. was born in 1950 and now lives in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. She is a tailor who uses cloth to process into clothes for the villagers. In this business, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to purchase a new sewing machine to replace the old one in order to produce better quality for her customers.
Her husband, Mr. Khoem Khat, is a Khmer priest who usualL. works in funerals and wedding ceremonies to make a small income to support his famiL.. Mrs. Heng L. has five children, four of whom are employed in different business activities while the youngest is attending school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loan.use: To purchase a new sewing machine in order to produce better quality for her customers.

loan.name: Ni Ketut Sumarmi

texts.id: Meski tergolong ibu yang masih muda dan baru mempunyai seorang anak yang sudah duduk di kelas 1 SD tidak membuat Ketut Sumarmi bisa bersantai-santai dengan kesehariannya. Kebutuhan hidup yang semakin meningkat mendorong Ketut untuk bekerja lebih keras membantu suaminya yang seorang karyawan swasta dengan gaji yang pas-pasan. Disamping mengolah ladangnya, Ketut juga memelihara babi di rumahnya dan ikut dalam aktifitas kelompok ternak Kembang Mekar di desanya. Dengan meminjam ke DINARI lewat program KIVA, Ketut mampu membeli 1 ekor induk babi serta pakannya yang kemudian dipeliharanya selama 6 bulan menghasilkan keuntungan Rp. 500.000 dari penjualan 6 ekor anak babinya. Karena keuntungan yang lumayan bagus, Ketut melanjutkan ke pinjaman kedua dengan jangka waktu yang sama yaitu 6 bulan dan kembali dibelikannya 1 ekor induk babi serta sisanya untuk pakan. Sekarang Ketut berhasil memelihara 2 ekor induk babi dan selama 6 bulan kedepan besar harapan Ketut untuk menghasilkan anak babi yang lebih banyak lagi sebab para pembeli bibit sudah menantinya. Pinjaman ini nantinya akan dikembalikan pada akhir masa pinjaman. Hasil yang dicapai Ketut sangat membantu keuangan keluarganya sehingga keperluan dan biaya sekolah anaknya pun bisa terpenuhi.
texts.en:
Being a young mother whose child sits in first grade, Ketut Sumarmi cannot be lazy. Ever rising living cost motivates Ketut to work hard to help her husband who works as a private employee with barely sufficient salary. Besides workin gin her rice field, Ketut also farms pigs in her home through Kembang Mekar group. Through a loan from Kiva channeled through DINARI, Ketut bought a breeder pig and feeds. She bred the pig for 6 months and earned $50 profit from the sale of 6 piglets. Due to the excellent result, Ketut is requesting a second loan with 6 month tenor to purchase additional breeder pig and feeds. With the 2 breeding pigs, Ketut hopes to produce more piglets in the next 6 month that can be sold ot her regular clients. The profit from her farm will be used to supplement her family's finances and pay her child's tuition.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase breeder pig an feeds

loan.name: Thuok

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuok P. is a villager in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province and she is a vegetable farmer. Since her field is too far from irrigation, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump in order to generate water to support her field.

Her husband, Mr. Chea Phat, is a construction worker who can make only a small income to support his family. Mrs. Thuok P. is 54 years old and the mother of seven children. Six of them are employed in different businesses, while the youngest one is attending school. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loan.use: to buy a pump to generate water to support her field

loan.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Mrs Thuy S. was born in 1958 and she lives in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. She is a cow breeder who raises nine cows. Her husband, Mr Chhit Beoun, is a construction worker. Mrs Thuy S. has seven children two of whom are employed in garment factory while another one is tailor.

Even though Mrs Thuy S.'s family has more than one business, they still cannot afford to build a new house so Mrs Thuy S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings in order to build a new house to replace the old one.

Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loan.use: To build a new house for her household.

loan.name: Ni Wayan Pori

texts.id: Wayan Pori adalah gambaran seorang istri sekaligus ibu rumah tangga yang sangat ulet membantu suaminya bertani serta mengembangkan usaha ternak babi sebagai pekerjaan lainnya. Ternak babi memang ditekuninya sejak lama terbukti Wayan tergabung dalam kelompok ternak Kembang Mekar dan setelah kerja sama dengan DINARI, Wayan mampu meningkatkan mutu babi peliharaanya. Pinjaman pertama digunakannya untuk membeli 4 ekor bibit babi serta pakannya. Selama 5 bulan pemeliharaan diperoleh keuntungan dari penjualan babinya sebesar Rp. 800.000,-. Ini bisa terjadi berkat ketekunan dari Wayan Pori memelihara babi serta pendampingan dari staf DINARI sendiri. Setelah melewati pinjaman pertama dengan hasil menggembirakan, Wayan Pori memutuskan untuk melanjutkan ke pinjaman kedua sebesar Rp. 1.500.000,-. Pinjaman ini berjangka waktu 6 bulan lalu dibelikannya 5 ekor bibit babi penggemukan serta pakannya. Wayan berharap hasil bagus pada pinjaman pertama akan merembet ke pinjaman kedua sehingga dengan demikian hasilnya akan meningkat karena populasi babinya bertambah. Pinjaman ini akan dilunasi pada akhir masa pinjaman. Keuntungan yang diperoleh Wayan sangat menolong keluarganya dalam memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari serta keperluan anak-anaknya.
texts.en:
Wayan Pori is a very diligent housewife. She helps her husband work the field and farm pigs on the side. She has been farming pigs for a long time. She is also a part of Kembang Mekar farming coop that is affiliated with DINARI. Through training from the group, Wayan was able to increase the quality of her farmed pigs. She used first loan obtained from DINARI to purchase 4 piglets and feeds. After 5 months, she sold the pis for $ 80 profit. This result was due to her own diligence and DINARI's technical assistance. Motivated by the success of her first loan cycle, she is currently seeking second loan for $175 with 6 months tenor. She plans to use the money to purchase 5 fattening pigs and feeds. Wayan is hopeful that she can earn more profit from more pigs. She will use the additional profit to help her family's daily finances and raise her kids.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purhcase pigs and feeds

loan.name: Farmer Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vat K. C. is the leader of a group of four in Kampong Svay Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who now does not have enough money to buy rice seeds to cultivate rice. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

Her husband, Mr. Soth Sengleang, is a house constructor who can only make a small income to support his family. Mrs. Vat K. C. is 44 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the three remaining are attending the local school.

loan.use: To buy rice seeds to cultivate rice in her field

loan.name: Ni Wayan Subeg

texts.id: Tinggal di pedesaan tentunya hanya bertani saja yang bisa ditekuni Wayan Subeg bersama suaminya. Hasil dari mengolah ladang yang tidak menentu dan tidak mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga membuat Wayan meningkatkan usaha ternak babinya sebagai pekerjaan sampingan. Wayan memutuskan untuk bekerja sama dengan DINARI dan masuk anggota kelompok ternak babi Kembang Mekar yang merupakan program dari DINARI sendiri. Pinjaman pertama yang diperoleh Wayan digunakan untuk membeli 1 ekor induk babi serta pakannya. Pemeliharaan yang dilakukan sangat sederhana dengan kandang yang seadanya saja. Setelah 5 bulan dipelihara, induk babi tersebut menghasilkan 8 ekor anak babi yang kemudian dijual menghasilkan keuntungan bersih sebesar Rp. 1000.000,-. Dari hasil ini Wayan melanjutkan ke pinjaman kedua dengan besar Rp. 1.500.000,- dalam jangka waktu 6 bulan pengembalian yang kemudian dibelikannya 1 ekor induk babi lagi serta pakan yang lebih bermutu dari sebelumnya. Oleh sebab itu Wayan berharap keuntungan yang diperoleh pun akan meningkat. Program DINARI ini menurut Wayan sangat baik untuk peningkatan penghasilan keluarganya yang dulunya pas-pasan sekarang menjadi lebih mapan. Karena Wayan masih harus menyekolahkan anaknya di bangku SD serta memenuhi kebutuhan anak keduanya yang masih bayi.
texts.en:
Ni Wayan Subeg and her husband are farmers living in the village. However, the uncertain income is often not enough to fulfill all her family's needs. This motivated her to farm pigs to supplement her income. Wayan decided to seek financial and technicla assistance from DINARI through Kembang Mekar farming group. She used the first loan to purchase 1 breeder pig and required feeds. She used simple farming techniques. After 5 months, the pigs produced 8 piglets that brought her $100 profit. This encouraging result made Wayan apply for second loan for $175 with 6 months tenor. She plans to use the fund to purchase an additional breeder pig and higher quality feeds. She hopes that her earnings will increase. She thinks that this DINARI progrma is very useful in increasing her family's income and improve her family's quality of life. Wayan still need to pay her kid's tuition money and fulfill the needs of her second infant child.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase Pigs and Feeds

loan.name: Thi Mai's Group

texts.vi:
C L Thi Mai 48 tui, ma s thanh vin 06030006 c la ngi phu n rt chiu kho. C lam kha nhiu ngh nh chn vit e, hin nha c co 200 con. Ngoai ra c con lam 360m2 trng rau mung ban hang ngay, chng c chn tru thu. Vi vy tng thu nhp hang cua gia inh khoang 160.000/ ngay. Vi s tin o c co iu kin cho 5 a con i hoc. C a tra ht vn chu ky trc va tip tuc lam n xin vay chu ky 2 vi s tin la 3.360.000 mua vit va cam chn nui. Trong nhom c con co 5 thanh vin khac cung vay vn

.
  • Nguyn Thi Nguyt 40 tui ma s 06030008 vay 3808.000, thi gian vay 12 thang mua thm hoa qua v ban
  • Lu Thi Lan 24 tui ma s 06030009 vay 4.256.000,thi gian 12 thang mua ga ging( ga thit)
  • Kiu Thi Hng ma s 06030010 vay 5.152.000, thi gian 12 thang mua ga ging (ga e)
  • Nghim Thi Thanh ma s 06030005 vay 4.704.000, thi gian vay 12 thang mua may lam my
  • Nguyn Thi Thanh ma s 06030033 vay 3186.000, thi gian vay 6 thang mua cam chn nui ga e, vi mc tra 135.000 / tun.
texts.en:
Ms. L Thi Mai, 48 years old, no 06030006. She is a very hard-working housewife with many activities, like raising egg-laying ducks (currently 200). Besides, she also grows 360 square meters of water spinach to sell every day. Her husband works as a buffalo herder. With all of this, the family's income is about 160.000 per day, and allows her take care of her 5 school-age children. She has already paid back all the previous loan and has applied for a second loan of 3.360.000 in order to buy ducks and duck feed. There are 5 other borrowing members in her group

.
  • Nguyn Thi Nguyt, 40 years old, no 06030008, is borrowing 3.808.000 over 12 months in order to buy and resell fruit
  • Lu Thi Lan, 24 years old, no 06030009, is borrowing 4.256.000 over 12 months in order to buy and raise meat chicken
  • Kiu Thi Hng, no 06030010, is borrowing 5.152.000 over 12 months in order to buy and raise egg-laying chicken
  • Nghim Thi Thanh, no 06030005, is borrowing 4.704.000 over 12 months to buy a noodle machine
  • Nguyn Thi Thanh, no 06030033, is borrowing 3.186.000 over 6 months to buy chicken feed. She intends to pay back 135.000 per week.

    Translated from Vietnamese by Minh Bui, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchasing chicken and ducks

loan.name: Thi Bich Hang's Group

texts.vi:
Chi C. Thi Bich Hng 30 tui, ma s 06030034 chi va ca nhom ln u tin tham gia vay vn cua SEDA. Thay cac chi em phu n trong thn vay vn chi cung tim hiu cach thc vay tra. Sau khi c can b tin dung t vn chi rt thich tham gia vi c tit kim tra dn.Chi ng ky tham gia vay 3.186.000 v ly thm cam ban cho cac h chn nui trong lang.Chi co 2 con ang i hoc, trng chi cung giup chi nhiu trong cng vic bun ban. Trong nhom chi con co 4 thanh vin na cung tham gia vay vn

.
  • Chi Lu Thi Bc 35 tui, ma s 06030035 vay 3.186.000 tra trong 6 thang v mua cam chn nui ga e
  • Chi inh Thi Tp 58 tui ma s 06030036 vay 3186.000 mua ln ging
  • Chi Nguyn Thi Vn 33 tui ma s 06030037 vay 3186.000 mua ng n bong
  • Anh Kiu Vn dung 24 tui ma s 06030038 vay 3186.000gg mua ga nui
texts.en:
Ms. C. Thi Bich Hng, 30 years old, no 06030034. Her group is borrowing for the first time from the SEDA fund. All the housewives in the group worked together to find ideas to invest and pay back the loans. She is very eager to adhere to be able to save and repay gradually. She is asking for a loan of 3.186.000 to buy animal feed and resell at the market to the village farmers. She has 2 school-age children, who also help her out when there is a lot of sales activity. There are 4 other Fund participants in her group

.
  • Ms. Lu Thi Bc, 35 years, no 06030035, borrowing 3.186.000 over 6 months to buy chicken feed
  • Ms. inh Thi Tp, 58 years, no 06030036, borrowing 3.186.000 to buy pigs
  • Ms. Nguyn Thi Vn, 33 years, no 06030037, borrowing 3.186.000 to buy corn for use as animal feed
  • Mr. Kiu Vn, 24 years, no 06030038, borrowing 3.186.000 to buy chicken to raise

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Minh Bui, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying animal feed

loan.name: Asad

texts.en:
Asad U. is the father of 3 children and one of the residents of Ningarhar Province. He is 31 and graduated from class twelve. Asad and his two brothers are living with their parents in a small rental house in Behsood district; his father is an official and his two brothers are studying in a public school.

Asad U. is an electrician; he has been working in this field for about ten years. Before that he was a tailor, but he says that he wasn't able to solve all his financial problems through this business, therefore he changed it, and after one year of private studying, he became an electrician.

Asad is a hard-working man; he can cover his family expenditures, such as house rent, shop rent, or buying other necessary goods for the house. Recently Asad decided to purchase some new electrical equipment for his shop, and through it expand his business as much as possible, because he thinks that he couldn't provide all the things needed for his clients, therefore he had to buy it. But Asad doesn't have enough money in hand, so he has requested that AFSG give him a 50,000 Afghani loan to achieve his goal.

Asad U. dreams of creating a large electrical store and recruiting other workers to his business. Also he thanks the lenders who make possible this opportunity for people like him to make their dreams come true.

loan.use: To purchase new electrical equipment for his shop

loan.name: Noor

texts.en:
Ten years ago, this 46-year-old man was a military officer, but now he has a bicycle repair shop. He is Noor M., the father of 8 children, and a resident of Ningarhar Province. He lives in a rental house which has just two rooms and a small yard.

Noor M. worked as military officer for about 12 years. At that time, he was single, but when he got married, he left his job and started a business, because he thought he might not be able to provide for all his family expenditures on 2000 Afghanis (US$ 40) monthly salary. Therefore he opened a bicycle repair shop, and still now he is working there.

Noor has four sons; the older one is working as a blacksmith, but the three others are studying in public school. Meanwhile they are helping their father in their spare time.

A few months ago, Noor has decided to buy a car to use as a taxi for his son and some equipment for his shop, because he wants to pave the way for his other three sons to just keep at their studying. For this purpose, he needs to expand his business more and increase his daily income. This was the reason that he requested a 50,000 Afghani individual loan from AFSG , to make his dreams come true.

Finally Noor M. hopes the lenders will provide this opportunity for him, to utilize his capability. Also he thanks them a lot.

loan.use: To buy a taxi and equipment for his shop

loan.name: Bosiljka

texts.en:
Bosiljka Risti was born in 1953. She is divorced and she lives with her two children. She works in a bakery earning 300 KM monthly. She has also another income of making cakes at home.

This will be her first loan with WWI in the amount of 600 KM ($US450). She wants to buy materials for making cakes at home, so she will sell more cakes after work time and in that way her life and life for her children will be easier.

loan.use: To buy materials for making of cakes.

loan.name: Madi

texts.en:
Madi G. is a resident of the Jomi district. 34-years-old, he is married and has three children. He attended secondary school, and has raised sheep for more than seven years. He has a small parcel of land. Each year after gathering in the harvest, he keeps a portion for his family and sells the rest at the local market, an endeavor that helps him to feed his family. Agriculture is his familys sole source of income. Now he wishes to purchase high-quality seed. He plans to repay the loan within four months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of high-quality seed

loan.name: Saltanat

texts.en:
Saltanat H. is a resident of the Jomi region. She is a 68-year-old widow with one child. Saltanat attended secondary school, and has purchased and sold farm animals for more than 30 years. She is assisted by her son. Together, they buy calves and lambs at the local market and fatten them for resale at a profit. This business is the sole source of income for their family. At present Saltanat plans to purchase a steer and is taking out a 12-month loan for that purpose.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of a steer

loan.name: Alimardon

texts.en:
Alimardon H. is a resident of the Jomi region. He is 52 years old and married with five children. He completed high school and has 25 years of experience raising livestock, a business that permits him to support his large family. He is their sole source of income, as his wife is a homemaker and his children are in school. Alimardon purchases young steers locally, fattens them for 45 days, and then puts them on the market. With this loan, he plans to buy his next steer for fattening. He will repay the loan over the course of 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of a steer

loan.name: Halimabi

texts.en:
Halimabi H. resides in the Jomi region. 30-years-old, she is married and has two children. She attended secondary school, and works in agriculture. She has a small parcel of land on which she raises sheep. After gathering in her crop, she sells the surplus at the market or barters for other food products such as flour, rice and oil. With the loan she plans to buy seed and fertilizer. She intends to repay the loan within four months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of seed and fertilizer

loan.name: Sadriddin

texts.en:
Sadriddin H. resides in the Khuroson district. The 23-year-old man is married and has one child. For more than three years Sadriddin has worked in agriculture. He grows corn. Upon gathering in his crops, he provides his cow and chickens with feed, then puts away enough for the next year. The remainder he sells to his neighbors at a profit. Sadriddin presently wishes to purchase fertilizer in order to improve his crops. He intends to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loan.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor R. is a resident of the Khuroson district. 43-years-old, she is married and has four children. She attended secondary school, and now engages in the buying and selling of farm animals. She buys young lambs locally, fattens and sells them for a profit. Gulbahor has been in this business for three years, and on the income from this endeavor she supports her family since her husband is temporarily unemployed. At present, she intends to purchase three sheep, and plans to repay the loan within ten months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of three lambs

loan.name: Odina

texts.en:
Odina A. resides in the town of Kulob. 47-years-old, he is married and has five children. He has a stall at the local market where he trades in meat. He buys farm animals locally and feeds them. After fattening, he sells the meat for a profit at the market. His business is the sole source of income for his large family. At present he wishes to purchase three steers and plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of three steers

loan.name: Yunus

texts.en:
Yunus A. is 59 years old. He lives in Isfara town. He is married and has three children.

Yunus processes and sells dried fruits in the local central market. He is experienced in the business of making dried fruits. Yunus is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today are working adults thanks to his example.

Yunus purchases dried fruits in the market and processes them together with his wife who is pictured in the photo. Because he buys dried apricot wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for customers of different means.

All this allows Yunus to make his business quite successful and it brings in stable income for the family. Today Yunus is requesting 2000 Somoni (600 USD) for a term of 9 months. He is going to spend the loan purchasing dried fruits to further process and sell. Yunus expresses his gratitude for everyone supporting him.

loan.use: Increasing the range of goods he sells

loan.name: Batuli's Tusongembele Group

texts.en:
Batuli is married with three children aged 20,18 and six years old. She own a small shop and she is a tomatoes and onion seller. Every day, she works from 5am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Batuli is looking for a loan to buy more tomatoes, onion and other commodities for expansion of her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group members Azmina, Siti, Zainab, Sunna, Raya and Ashura.

loan.use: To buy more tomatoes, onion and other commodities.

loan.name: Zulfiya

texts.en:
Zulfiya S. resides in the city of Kulob. She is 28 years old and lives with her retired parents. Zulfiya has more than two years experience in sewing womens clothing. She both sews to order and makes dresses to sell at the local markets. Zulfiya wishes to purchase fabric with her loan and plans to repay it within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of fabric

loan.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka Jovii was born in 1966. She is divorced and she has one child. She is employed in a bakery and she earns there 350 KM monthly. Milka works, also, on agriculture and from this she earns 200 KM in a month.

Milka wants to make better life for her child, so she decided to take a loan with Women for Women International in the amount of 600 KM ($US450). She will use this loan to buy food for poultry and pigs. After a few months she will sell some of the poultry and a pig and she hopes to earn in this way. Her wish is to makes her little business with poultry and pigs.

loan.use: To buy food for poultry and pigs.

loan.name: Rukhsora

texts.en:
G. Rukhsora is 42 years old. She is an optimistic married mother of three children with a strong desire to move up in the world.

As her children grew, so did the costs of their education, and the salary her husband made was insufficient to cover it all, so he decided to leave for Russia to earn more.

For five years Rukhsora has had a small business drying and remaking apricots. Thanks to the quality of her products, she has earned a solid reputation among her customers and the demand for her goods has grown allowing Rukhsora to contribute significantly to the household and education of her son.

Today Rukhsora requests 2500 Somoni ($US750) for the term of 12 months. She is going to spend the loan for purchasing dried apricots with the purpose of processing and reselling. Rukhsora expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her.

Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working.

loan.use: Purchasing dried apricots for processing and selling.

loan.name: Rukia's Twaomba Salama Group

texts.en:
Rukia is 49 and married with 6 children between 32 and 12 years old. She has been a food and snacks seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a minimum monthly profit from her sales.

Rukia is now looking for a loan to buy more food items to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Asha and Hasina.

loan.use: To buy more food items for the expansion of her business.

loan.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 30 years old. She is married with 1 child aged 1 year old. She has been a phone voucher and juice seller since 2002. Every day, she works from 8am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Fatma is now requesting a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loan.use: To expand her business by adding to her current stock

loan.name: Mosi

texts.en:
Mosi is 34 years old and is married with 3 children between the ages of 13 and 5. She has been selling charcoal since 2000. She works everyday from 8am to 6pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Mosi is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal for re-sale.

loan.use: To buy more charcoal for re-sale.

loan.name: Karim

texts.en:
I. Karim is a self-sacrificing, loving father, 60 years old with three children, all of whom are independent. In spite of his age, he continues to fight to get his beloved family ahead and improve their economic situation.
Ever since he was very little, Karim has been around people raising animals, and thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sales of cattle he has been able to bring stability to his family.
The desire that Karim harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. By selling these, he can create more income for his family. Above all, he hopes to offer a better quality of life for his beloved grandchildren, who always supports him unconditionally in his daily work as the photo, showing one of his grandchildren, shows.
Karim requests 4000 Somoni ($US1,175) for the term of 12 months.
Lets get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him keep bringing well being and security to the members of his family.

loan.use: Purchasing of cattle and small cattle to expand the business.

loan.name: Abdujalol

texts.en:
Abdujalol J. is 31 years old. He is married with two children of school-age for whom he works very hard. His wife is a homemaker. Abdujalol processes and sells dried apricots. Having been working in this kind of business for 4 years, he has gained rich experience.

Abdujalol purchases apricots from farmers and after processing them he resells them in the market. Because he buys apricots wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for customers of different means. All this allows Abdujalol to make his business quite successful and it brings in stable income for the family.

Abdujalol wants his children to be well-educated and with this purpose in mind, he wishes to send them to better schools. To be able to do that, today Abdujalol is requesting 4000 Somoni (1175 USD) for a term of 12 months. He is going to spend his loan purchasing more dried apricots with the purpose of processing and selling them. Abdujalol expresses his gratitude for everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan on time.

loan.use: Purchasing dried apricots to increase the range of goods he sells

loan.name: Neema's Tuimarike Group

texts.en:
Neema is a 20 year old single woman. She has been selling clothes since 2006. She works daily from 8am to 6pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Neema is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes for the expansion of her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Ridhwana.

loan.use: To buy more clothes for the expansion of her business.

loan.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is 34 years old and is married with 3 children ages 14, 11 and 2. She has run her own shop since 2000. She works everyday from 8am to 5pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Safia is now requesting a loan to buy more commodities to increase her current stock for the expansion of her business.

loan.use: To buy more commodities to increase her current stock for the expansion of her business

loan.name: Nong

texts.en:
This is the third time Mrs. Nong S. has asked for a loan to improve her business activity. She is a villager in Ponlai Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and re-sell later at a better price. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, which is why she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice.
Mrs. Nong S. is a 58 year-old widow with two children who are both attending school. Previously, Mrs. Nong S. had obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business. She has fully paid it back.

loan.use: To ask for a loan to buy more rice to keep in stock and re-sell later at a better price.

loan.name: Kong

texts.en:
Mr. Kong C. is a villager in Tbeng Khpuos Village in Kcmpong Chhang Province. He is a teacher who makes a small salary to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Seng Yun, is a farmer who cultivates twice a year. They have two children, one of whom is a wedding makeup person who makes up the bride and groom in wedding ceremonies, while the other has passed the test to work as a garment worker in Korea.
Unfortunately, Mr. Kong C. does not have enough money for his child to go to Korea. Thus, he has decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. His wife is on the left in the photo.

loan.use: to ask for a loan for for his child to go to work in Korea.

loan.name: Sahau

texts.en:
Sahau is 31 years and is divorced with one 11 year old child. She sells charcoal and firewood. She works daily and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Sahau is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood to increase her stock.

loan.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood to increase her stock.

loan.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with 7 children between the ages of 29 and 12 years old. She has been selling charcoal and food since 1998. She works everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Mariam is now requesting a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loan.use: To expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loan.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a 25 year old single woman. She began selling shoes and bedsheets in 2008. She works everyday from 8am to 6pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Riziki is now requesting a loan to buy more shoes and bedsheets for her business.

loan.use: To buy more shoes and bedsheets for her business.

loan.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 24 years old and she is single. She has been a bread seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Elizabeth is now looking for a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loan.use: To expand her business by increasing her current stock

loan.name: Mwanakhamis

texts.en:
MwanaK. is 50 years old and is divorced with a 25 year old. She has been selling food since 2005. She works everyday from 6am to 7pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

MwanaK. now requests a loan to buy more food items like rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables and bananas for the expansion of her business.

loan.use: To buy more food items for the expansion of her business.

loan.name: Marcelline

texts.fr: Dame S. Marcelline est ne le 11 juin 1970 Adjarra, dans le dpartement de l'Oum. Elle est mre de 03 enfants, Isaac 18 ans, Enock 15 ans et Sonia 10 ans, tous scolariss. Elle vend des produits de beauts et des ptes dentifrices qu'elle achte du Nigeria un pays voisin. Elle vient solliciter ce prt de 150 000 pour augmenter son stock de produits de beaut et pour couvrir toute la demande de sa clientle.
texts.en:
Ms. Marcelline S. was born on June 11, 1970 in Adjarra, in the county of Oum. She is the mother of three children: Isaac, age 18, Enock, age 15, and Sonia, age 10, who are all in school. She sells beauty products and toothpaste that she buys from Nigeria, a neighboring country. She has come to request this loan of 150,000 francs to increase her stock of beauty products and to meet all the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy 10 boxes of Fair Light lotions and 25 boxes of Coco Butter creams

loan.name: Chu Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Chu Thi T. is 50 years old. With the first loan worth VND 2 million, she raised ornamental birds. At first the family did encounter some difficulties, but after ten years they have been very experienced in their business. Today this business is her family's main source of income. Besides, they have earnings from livestock raising and farming. Hence, her family's economy is developing and getting more and more stable. For the next loan cycle, she applies for VND 9 million to further invest in her business to enhance the family's economy.
texts.en:
Note: the original description was in English

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Business

loan.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Dao Thi T. is 39 years old. She has been in TYM Fund since 2006. With VND 500,000 that she borrowed from TYM for the first time, she bought ducks for raising. At that time it was just a small business but now her family has a relatively big duck farm. Today the main business of the family is raising ducks on the farm. Besides, she and her husband has bought a threshing-machine to serve local farmers during harvest season. With an income of about VND 45 million per year, the family have more money to invest in their children's education and to improve their living quality. In the coming time, she wants to borrow VND 9 million to buy breeding ducks and chicken-feed.
texts.en:
Note: the original description was in English

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Raising

loan.name: Le Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Le Thi B. is 57 years old. She joined TYM in 2004 and used her first loan to raise and trade ornamental birds. This business is the family's main source of income. In 2006, to create jobs for her two grown-up sons, she bravely borrowed a loan to open a mechanical workshop. This business goes on smoothly and brings about VND 100,000 per day. With an income of VND 5 million/month, the economy of Mrs. B.'s family is more stable. That is why she has money to send a child to university. She now wants to borrow VND 9 million to buy more raw materials for the workshop.
texts.en:
Note: the original description is in English.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: buy more raw materials for the workshop

loan.name: Luu Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Luu Thi C., aged 52, has 3 children, two of whom are grown-up. Before joining TYM, her family caught fish in the sea. This business was not stable as it depended a lot on the weather. Therefore, in 2005 she joined TYM Fund and switched to trading. Everyday her husband goes to agents to buy goods for her, then she sells these goods at some markets. With reasonable price and enthusiastic service, her business is going on well and brings about a stable income of VND 3 million/month. For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow VND 9 million to invest more in this business.
texts.en:
Note: the original description is in English.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Business

loan.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Ngo Thi H. is 37 years old. Before she joined TYM, her family grew rice and traded mats. However, in 2006, the demand for mats decreased. As a result, her family switched to elastic band trading. With the first loan worth VND 3 million, her husband started trading elastic bands. Although this was the first time he traded this kind of product, the business still went on well as they were experienced in trading. At present, besides the income of VND 3 million from her husband's business, Mrs. H.'s family have other sources of income from animal raising and farming. Therefore, after 2 years in TYM Fund, with the loans, profit from loans and their own capital, Mrs. H.'s family has built a spacious house. For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow VND 9 million to invest in elastic band trading
texts.en:
Note: the original description is in English.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: to invest in elastic band trading

loan.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., aged 44, joined TYM Fund in 2004. Nowadays besides farming, she buys pigs and sell pork. Every day, her husband buys pigs and slaughters them and she sells this pork at markets. On festive days, the demand for pork usually increases and her family may gain an income of CND 300,000 per day. With a stable income from pork trading, she and her husband have more money to send her daughter to university in Ho Chi Minh city. For the next loan cycle, they want to borrow VND 9 million to invest in this business.
texts.en:
Note: the original description is in English.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Business

loan.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Nguyen Thi L. is 34 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 2006. At that time she borrowed VND 2 million to raise pigs. Today this business brings about a stabL. income for her family. Her husband, a builder, also gives her a hand to raise pigs and look after their two children. Currently their average income is VND 2.5 million per month. For the next loan cycL., she applies for VND 6 million to buy more sows.
texts.en:
Note: the original description is in English.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: buy sows

loan.name: Dang Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Dinh Thi H., 56 years old, is a pensioner. In 2006 she joined TYM Fund and borrowed the first loan worth VND 3 million to trade mats. In 2007, her family bravely decided to switch to tyre and tube business. With the total income of VND 5 million from this business plus her pension, Mrs H.'s economy is getting more and more stable. For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow VND 9 million to invest in this business.
texts.en:
Note: the original description was in English

Translated from Vietnamese by KH. Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Business

loan.name: Dong Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Dong Thi K. is 53 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 2006. She used the first loan worth VND 1 million to raise pigs. Everyday her husband assisted her with this business and also worked as a builder to earn more income for the family. With her own effort and assistance of her husband and six grown-up children, the family's economy has become better and gradually got stable. For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow VND 7 million to invest in pig raising.
texts.en:
Note: the original description was in English

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Raising

loan.name: Genevive

texts.fr: Dame T. Genevive ge de 48 ans est ne Porto Novo au sud est du Bnin. Elle est marie et mre de 03 enfants, Tobi g de 20 ans, Cedric g de 16 ans et Rose ge de 10 ans, tous scolariss. Elle achte des tissus au march et des chiffons auprs des grossistes, puis revient coudre elle-mme ses coussins qu'elle vend au march. Vu l'ampleur que prend son activit, elle veut acheter une nouvelle machine coudre pour tre plus rapide et satisfaire au mieux sa clientle temps.
texts.en:
Mrs. Genevive T. is 48 years old and was born in Porto Novo south east of Benin. She is married and the mother of three (3) children who have attended school; Tobi age 20, Cedric age 16 and Rose age 10.
