She buys fabric at the marketplace and cloth filler from wholesalers, then at home, sews the cushions herself to sell at the marketplace. In order to increase her business she would like to purchase a newer sewing machine that would service her customers more quickly.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loan.name: Le Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Le Thi K., aged 50, has been in TYM Fund since 2003. With the first loan worth VND 2 million, she bought and sold pork. Before joining TYM, she was experienced in this job. So since she had more capital, her business has been more profitable. Besides this business, her family raises some buffalos and pigs. Therefore, her economy is stable with the total income of VND 4.5 million/month. For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow VND 9 million to buy and sell more pork.
texts.en:
Note: the original description is in English.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: to buy and sell more pork.

loan.name: Mai Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Mai Thi L. is 34 years old. She joined TYM fund in 2004. She invested her first loan worth VND 1.5 million in trading and livestock raising. Since then, these businesses has brought about a stable income for the family. At present, apart from these businesses, she and her husband also work at local restaurants. With a income of VND 4.5 million/month, her family's economy is developing well. For the next loan cycle, she applies for VND 9 million to invest in trading and livestock raising.
texts.en:
Note: the original description is in English.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: to invest in trading and livestock raising.

loan.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes Q. is divorced and has 6 children. She has received schooling through junior high education. Agnes sells bed sheets, soap, rice and other goods at Kokoado in Elmina, which she has done since 2004. Agnes uses her income to feed the family and pay their utility bills. Agnes will use this loan to add to her capital to increase stock for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to reinvest for the further expansion of her business.

loan.use: To add to her capital to increase stock

loan.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi L. joined TYM in 2005. At first she borrowed VND 3 million to grow shrimp, as she and her husband had been experienced in aquaculture for almost 10 years. This business brings a considerable income for the family. At present, Mrs. L. helps her husband with shrimp growing and weaves mats to generate extra income for her family. Owing to their diligence and effective use of loans, Mrs. L.'s standard of living is improving more and more with an income of VND 80,000/year. For the next loan cycle, she is applying for VND 7 million to buy more breeding shrimp.

loan.use: Buy more breeding shrimps

loan.name: Adiza

texts.en:
Adiza M. sells groceries such as tinned tomatoes, milk, soft drinks and other products at Elmina. Adiza has received Junior High Education. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a businessman.

Adiza has been selling groceries since 1998. She is responsible for paying for food for the family and the payment of their utility bills. Her loan will be used to add to her capital to increase her grocery inventory in her store. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in a building project she has started with her husband.

loan.use: to add to her working capital

loan.name: Sarah Namukasa's Group

texts.en:
Sarah is a leader of 5 members of a group. She is a 32-year-old married woman with 6 children, aged between 16 and 1 1/2. Five of her children go to school, and she also takes care of her mother. She owns and resides in a 3-room house living with 7 people. There is no electricity and no piped water.

The family gets 3 meals a day. Sarah resides and works in a semi-urban area that is on the outskirts of Kampala. Sarah goes to Kampala for shopping once a week and rents her business premises at 40,000 per month. She works 7 days a week. She operates a ladies' salon and works with all categories of people. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Sarah works on an average of 3 people per day. She uses public transportation to get to her business. Sarah has been in this business for over 5 years and doesn't have any other businesses.

She has been with MCDT for 1 1/2 years, working all this long with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to increase stock in her business and also to put up a house in her plot so as to earn some rent. .

loan.use: To incease stock in her business and to build a house

loan.name: Orison

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Orison B. is a married 61-year-old woman with five children; she also supports two other dependents. All of her children and dependents are between 25 and 36 years of age. In 2007, Orison opened a pharmacy, from which she earns about 120 USD per month. Orison is requesting a loan of 875 USD in order to purchase additional stocks of medicine in bulk. Orison is assisted at her pharmacy by one employee and plans to increase the quantity and range of her offerings in the future.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loan.use: To purchase medicines in bulk

loan.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Consolata D., a married woman who is 34 years old with two children aged 10 and 13. She owns a beauty salon that she established in 2004. She currently earns about $400 as monthly profit from this business. She has two employees who help her in her business, and together they work 6 days per week and 11 hours per day. Consolata is requesting a loan of US$ 875 to enable her to open another beauty salon.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loan.use: To obtain capital to open a new beauty salon

loan.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida T. has been selling groceries like canned tomatoes, milk, soft drinks, etc at Kokoado in Elmina since 1997. Vida has received a junior high education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a trader. She is responsible for paying to feed her family and their utility bills. Her loan will be used to add to her capital to increase the groceries in her store for sale. Vida hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for the expansion of this business.

loan.use: Her loan will be used to add to her capital to increase the groceries in her store for sale.

loan.name: Sinet

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinet S., 36, and her husband, Mr. Heang Hao, 36, who live in a small village off of National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, married in 1994 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. All of them study in local schools.
Mrs. Sinet has been growing rice since 1979. She grows in her small farm far from home for selling and for food. Her husband has been a policeman for over ten years. Sinet is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to purchase rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides for growing rice.

loan.use: For purchasing rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide

loan.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun M. (shown in the picture on the left with her niece), 51, is a widow with three children: one son and two daughters. Besides her children, she has two nieces living with her. Her son is a construction worker and one daughter works in a plywood factory. The younger daughter studies in a local school. Her two nieces are assisting in her business. The family lives along National Road Number Six about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.
Mrs. Savoeun has been selling Unsorm (a kind of Khmer cake made from banana, coconut, and sticky rice) for two years. She makes the cakes at her home and sells them around her village and a nearby village. Now she wants to create another business for her nieces to sell fruit. Therefore Savoeun is requesting a loan of $350 to purchase fruit for her nieces to sell, and to buy more material to make cakes to sell.

loan.use: To purchase fruit for resale and to purchase material to make cakes to sell.

loan.name: Vichai

texts.en:
Mr. Vichai K. and his wife, Mrs. Sokly Chin, live in a small village off National Road Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 2004 and have one son.
Mr. Vichai has been a taxi driver for many years, while his wife is a garment factory worker. He also works cutting grass to sell for cow feed. He travels to a nearby village by motorbike to cut the grass, and sells it along National Road Two. Now it is the rainy season, so he gathers much more grass. He needs to buy a trailer to carry the extra grass. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase a trailer to carry grass to sell.

loan.use: To purchase a trailer to carry grass to sell.

loan.name: Seangly

texts.en:
Mrs. Seangly K., 45, and her husband, Mr. Virak Choeun, 45, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1995 and have three children: two sons and one daughter.
Mrs. Seangly has been a silk weaver for over ten years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a taxi driver.
Seangly is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loan.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loan.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mr. Seng S., 45, and his wife, Mrs. Borin Pov, 47, who live along National Road Number Six about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1983 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of their children work in a plywood factory and the youngest one studies in a local school.

Mr. Seng and his wife have been farming for over ten years. They grow many types of vegetables in the farm near their house and sell them to the middleman in the village who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Seng is requesting a loan of US$ 200 to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticides for growing vegetables.

loan.use: To purchase seed, pesticides and fertilizer for growing vegetables

loan.name: Mat

texts.en:
Mr. Mat E., 39, and his wife, Mrs. Sarifas E., 41, live along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have three children: one son and two daughters. One of their daughters sells beef with their relatives, and the other two children study in a local school.
Mr. Mat and his wife have been selling recycling materials for three years. They travE. about forty kilometers from their home to buy discarded household materials from villagers. Then they sell them to a wholesaler in their village. They need a motorbike to carry the materials. Therefore, Mat is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike.

loan.use: To purchase a motorcycle to carry recycling materials.

loan.name: James B.

texts.en:
James B. A. is married and has 2 children; they live in Elmina. He has received schooling through first degree level. James is a chemical seller but a teacher by profession. His monthly income as a teacher is not enough to meet the family's financial needs so he had to engage himself in the selling of chemicals after teaching to earn additional income, which he has done since 2002. His wife is a merchant.

James uses his income to pay for the children's school fees and utility bills. James will use the loan to add to his capital to increase the chemicals at the store to meet his ever-increasing customers' needs. With the new profits from his expanded business, James plans to pay for his children's schooling.

loan.use: to add to his working capital to increase the chemicals at the store

loan.name: Sles

texts.en:
Mr. Sles S., 58, and his wife, Mrs. Rokiyas Sman, 58, live along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1972 and have nine children: four sons and five daughters. Four of their children are married and live outside the family home. Two children assist in their parents' business, and the other three children study at a local school.
Mr. Sles and his wife have been garlic and chicken wholesalers for many years. They buy chickens from a nearby province, then carry them in their truck for resale at the market. They buy garlic at the Vietnam border for resale in Kampong Cham and Kampong Thum provinces. Currently the couple lacks the money to buy more garlic and chickens to sell. Therefore, Sles is requesting a loan of $1000 to expand his business.

loan.use: To purchase garlic and chickens for resale.

loan.name: Phalsim

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalsim U. and her husband, Mr. Rithy Om, who live along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1995 and have two daughters who study in local schools.

Mrs. Phalsim has been selling grocery items and vegetables for over ten years. She buys them from Prak Anchan market about five kilometers from her home for re-sale in her store in the village. We could not photograph her store because she had closed it for the day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Phalsim is requesting a loan of US$ 600 to purchase more grocery items for re-sale.

loan.use: To purchase more grocery items for re-sale at her store

loan.name: Lay

texts.en:
Mrs. Lay U., 49, and her husband, Mr. Thorn Uk, 53, live in a small village across the Mekong River and about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1983 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Four of the children study at the local school, and the youngest one stays at home.
Mrs. Lay has been a silk weaver for 28 years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a house builder for 18 years.
Lay is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loan.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loan.name: Hadjah Namuwawu's Group

texts.en:
Hadjah is the leader of a 4-member group. She is 55 years old and divorced with 6 children aged between 30 and 18 years. Two of her children go to school, and the rest are working. She stays with her brother who owns the home where she is staying with her school-going children. There are four people at home.

The family gets two meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. Hadjah works in Kibuye market in one of the city suburbs and deals in bananas. Hadjah doesn't incur any extra transport costs because she gets them from her place of work. She works seven days a week.

Hadjah sells to an average of 20 customers a day and sells both small and large quantities depending on the customers' wishes. Her main expenses include school fees and medication plus daily market dues.

She has been with MCDT for four years and is servicing her twelfth loan with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to increase the stock of her business. She aspires to educate her children up to university. .

loan.use: To incease stock in her business

loan.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent E. sells a variety of drinks at Elmina. Millicent has received a teacher training college education. She is single and has no children. Millicent has been selling drinks since 1993. She is responsible for paying rent and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy different kinds of drinks to be supplied to her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards acquiring her own house.

loan.use: Her loan will be used to buy different kinds of drinks to be supplied to her customers.

loan.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mrs. Phally S., 37, and her husband, Mr. Sorn Soy, 39, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1993 and have three sons who study in a local school.

Mrs. Phally has been selling grocery items for four years. She buys them from the market in Phnom Penh for re-sale at her store in the village. Her husband has been a mason for fifteen years. He does his work in the village and nearby villages.

Phally is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase more grocery items for re-sale.

loan.use: To purchase more grocery items for re-sale

loan.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap D., 40, and her husband, Mr. Cheng-ean Hean, 52, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1984 and have seven children: two sons and five daughters. Two of their children are construction workers, and two other children are silk weavers. Three children study at the local school.
Mrs. Sopheap has been a silk weaver for 25 years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband raises cows at home.
Sopheap is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase silk materials for her and her children's weaving business.

loan.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loan.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena C. sells clothing and fabric at the Elmina Market. Helena has received Junior High Education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a businessman.

Helena has been selling cloth and fabric since 1998. She is responsible for the feeding of the family and the payment of their utility bills. Her loan will be used to add to her capital to increase the quantity of cloth and fabric in her store for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband in the putting-up of the family house.

loan.use: to add to her capital to increase quantity of cloth and fabric in her store

loan.name: Mame Bousso

texts.fr: Mame Bousso F. est ne le 02 janvier 1960 Diourbel, elle est marie et vit avec son mari au qauartier champs de course Diourbel. Elle a une exprience de 15 ans dans la vente de lgumes. Elle sollicite ce pret pour renforcer son fond de roulement.
texts.en:
Mame Bousso F. was born on January 2, 1960 in Diourbel, is married, and lives with her husband in the Champs de Course district in Diourbel. She has fifteen years of experience in selling vegetables. She is requesting this loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy and sell vegetables

loan.name: Stella Y.

texts.en: Stella Y. S. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through senior high school. Stella sells groceries like canned tomatoes, milk, soft drinks, and others at Elmina, which she has done since 1999. Her husband is a trader. Stella uses her income to pay for utility bills and other family expenses. Stella will use the loan to purchase boxes of milk, Milo, bags of sugar, and other groceries. With the new profits from her expanded business, Stella plans to invest in a building project she has started with her husband.

loan.use: Stella will use the loan to purchase boxes of milk, Milo, bags of sugar, and other groceries.

loan.name: Marime

texts.fr: Marime M., marie, 4 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Face Nma depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle veut un prt pour acheter du lait, du sucre, du caf, des ufs, des ptes alimentaires macaroni, des jumbo, des tomates, des oignons et des pommes de terre pour renforcer son activit de vente de petit djeuner au march Grand Dakar. Ses revenus lui permettent damliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.<b>Le prt qu'elle sollicite sera rembours au bout de six mois en une seule chance.<b/>
texts.en:
Marime M. is married and has four children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Boucotte Face Nma for five and a half years. She wants a loan to buy milk, sugar, coffee, eggs, macaroni, Jumbo bouillon cubes, tomatoes, onions, and potatoes in order to bolster her business in breakfast sales at the marketplace Grand Dakar. Her income enables her to improve her family's living conditions. The loan that she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To sell breakfast foods

loan.name: Justice

texts.en:
Since 2006, Justice C. has been selling electrical items in Elmina, Ghana. Justice has received a Junior High Education, he is single, and he has no children. Justice is responsible for paying rent and other utility bills.

With a loan, Justice will be able to buy bulbs, cables, extension cords, and other supplies for his shop. He hopes to use the increased profits to reinvest in his business for future expansion.

loan.use: To buy bulbs, cables, extension cords, and other supplies for his shop.

loan.name: Khadija's Bega Kwa Bega Group

texts.en:
Khadija is 37 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 9, 7, and 3 years old. She has been running her own restaurant since 2007. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Khadija now hopes for a loan to expand her business by increasing her inventory. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Salma and Yustina, who have businesses dealing with bread sale and kiosk ownership.

loan.use: To expand her business by increasing her inventory

loan.name: Aramatoulaye Khassim

texts.fr: Aramatoulaye Khassim D., 48 ans, marie, 8 enfants sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Nma Sobeya depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son activit de vente dhuile de palme, de miel, de citron, de balais, de poisson et dhutre. Ses revenus lui permettent damliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et daider ses proches.<b>Elle sollicite un prt qui sera rembours au bout de six mois en une seule chance.<b/>
texts.en:
Aramatoulaye Khassim D., 48, is married and has 8 children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank Nma Sobeya for 6 and a half years. She would like to bolster her business selling palm oil, honey, lemons, brooms, fish and oysters. Her income allows her to improve living conditions for her family and help those near and dear to her. She is asking for a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: purchase and resale of foodstuffs and brooms

loan.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 37 years and is married. She sells buns. She works selling buns everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Sakina now hopes for a loan to expand her business.

loan.use: To expand her business.

loan.name: Pape Mafaye

texts.fr: Pape Mafaye D. est un jeune Diourbelois n le 1 mars 1980. Ill est menuisier mtallique de profession et gre son atelier au quartier Ndayane. Il sollicite ce pret pour acheter de la matire premire afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientle.
texts.en:
Pape Mafaye D. is young man from Diourbel who was born on March 1, 1980. He is a metal worker by profession and manages his workshop in the Ndayane district. He is requesting this loan to buy raw material to satisfy his customers better .

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Capital funds for metal working

loan.name: Tatu's Mungu Muweza Group

texts.en:
Tatu is 34 years and is married with 2 children ages 6 and 2. She also takes care of a 72 year old person. She has been selling clothes since 2005. She works everyday from 8am to 9pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Tatu is now requesting a loan to add to her current stock for the improvement of her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Fatma and Ashruna, who own businesses selling charcoal, oil and clothes.

loan.use: To add to her current inventory for the improvement of her business.

loan.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 48 years old and she is a widow with 3 children aged between 28 and 15 years old. She has been a food and vegetable seller since 2000. Every day, she works from 6:30am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Amina is now looking for a loan to improve her business by adding more food items and vegetables for re-sale.

loan.use: To improve her business by adding more food items and vegetables for re-sale.

loan.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Ibrahima B. est n le 05 mars en 1970 Fanaye. Il habite au quartier Ndayane avec sa famille. Depuis trois ans, il s'adonne l'levage de moutons chez lui. Il veut profiter de l 'hivernage pour renforcer son troupeau c'est pour cela qu'il sollicite ce pret.
texts.en:
Ibrahima B. was born on March 5, 1970 in Fanaye. He lives in the Ndayane district with his family. For three years, he has devoted himself entirely to raising sheep at home. He wants to take advantage of the winter season to strengthen his flock. That is why he is requesting this loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Raising sheep

loan.name: Asiya

texts.en:
Asiya is 29 years old and she is single. She has been a "khanga" (traditional Tanzanian clothing) and basket seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 8:30am to 4:30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Asiya now hopes for a loan to buy more baskets and "khanga" for re-sale.

loan.use: To buy more baskets and "khanga" for re-sale

loan.name: Mwanamimi

texts.en:
Mwanamimi is 49 years and is divorced with 2 children ages 11 and 9. She has been selling charcoal and bites since 2005. She works everyday from 8.30am to 4pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Mwanamimi is now requesting a loan to to buy more charcoal to sell and improve her sales.

loan.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loan.name: Djiby

texts.fr: Djiby D. est n en 1945 Awgaly. il habite au quartier champs de course de Diourbel. Son activit principale c'est l'achat et la vente de btail. il sollicite ce pret pour acheter de la nourriture de btail.
texts.en:
Djiby D. was born in 1945 in Awgaly. He lives in the Champs de Course neighborhood in Diourbel. His main business is buying and selling livestock. He is asking for this loan to buy fodder for his animals.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: fattening livestock for re-sale

loan.name: Ghanima's Ibadu Llahi Group

texts.en:
Ghanima is 47 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 28 and 15 years old. She has been a clothes and perfume seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 10:30am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Ghanima is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes and perfumes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Hamida.

loan.use: To buy more clothes and perfumes for her business.

loan.name: Loveness

texts.en:
Loveness is 30 years old and is married with a 5 year old child. She has run her own kiosk since 2006. She works everyday from 9am to 6pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Loveness is now requesting a loan to improve her business by adding to her current stock.

loan.use: To improve her business by adding to her current stock.

loan.name: Abdoul

texts.fr: Abdoul D. est n le 09 juin 1979 Diourbel .il a abandonn les tudes trs tot et avec l'aide de son frre il a pu avoir quelques chvres qu'il lve et revend sur le march l'occasion des crmonies religieuses.c'est dans le but de renforcer son troupeau qu'il sollicite ce pret.
texts.en:
Abdoul D. was born on June 9, 1979 in Diourbel. He left school at a young age and with the help of his brother, he managed to get some goats to raise and re-sell at the market before religious holidays and feast days. He is requesting this loan with a view to enlarging his flock.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: raising goats

loan.name: Clara

texts.fr: Clara S., 56 ans, marie est membre du banc villageois de Nma Sobeya depuis 6 ans. Elle achte des pagnes thioub tisss (pagnes tisss teints) quelle revend. Les revenus tirs de son commerce lui permettent damliorer les conditions de vie et de sant de sa famille.<b> Elle sollicite un prt qui sera rembours au bout de six mois en une seule chance.<b/>
texts.en:
Clara S., 56, is married and has been a member of the village bank Nma Sobeya for 6 years. She buys woven lengths of cloth called "thioub" (hand-dyed lengths of a traditional textile) which she re-sells. The income from her business allows her to improve the living conditions and health of her family. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: purchase and re-sale of lengths of textile called "thioub"

loan.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 29 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 9 and 3 years old. She has been a cloth (bedsheets & khanga--traditional Tanzanian cloth) seller since 2005. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Hawa now hopes for a loan to buy more bedsheets and khanga for re-sale.

loan.use: To buy more bedsheets and khanga for re-sale

loan.name: Mashavu

texts.en:
Mashavu is a single 25 year old woman. Since 2005, she has owned a small perfume shop. She works everyday from 7am to 5.30pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Mashavu is now requesting a loan to expand her business.

loan.use: To expand her perfume business.

loan.name: El H Mouhamed

texts.fr: Monsieur N. habite au quartier Moussant de thisIl est mari et pre de deux enfants. Il a une exprience de 27 ans dans la fabrication de meuble en bois. Il demande ce pret dans le but d'acheter de la matire premire pour terminer ses commandes en cours.
texts.en:
Monsieur N. lives in the Moussant district of This. He is married and the father of two children. He has 27 years experience in making wooden furniture. He is asking for this loan in order to buy raw materials so that he can finish orders he already has waiting to be filled.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: purchase of raw materials for making wooden furniture

loan.name: Mwanaid

texts.en:
Mwanaid is 29 years old and is married with 3 children between the ages of 9 and 2. She also cares for a 55 year old. She has been selling clothes since 1999. She works everyday from 8am to 3.30pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Mwanaid is now requesting a loan to improve her business by adding to her current stock.

loan.use: To improve her business by adding to her current stock.

loan.name: Thierno Omar

texts.fr: Thierno Omar S. est un boutiquier qui habite au quartier Malamine Senghor de This. Depuis dix ans ,il gre une boutique d'alimentation gnrale.C'est dans le but de renforcer son stock de marchandises afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientle qu'il sollicite ce pret.
texts.en:
Thierno Omar S. is a shopkeeper who lives in the Malamine Senghor district of This. For ten years, he has been managing a grocery store. It is with the goal of bolstering his stock of merchandise that he is requesting this loan, so he may satisfy his customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To bolster his stock of merchandise

loan.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is 46 years old and is married with 3 children between the ages 26 and 20. She has been selling clothes and food since 2006. She works everyday from 7am to 9.30pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

Pili now requests a loan to buy more food items and clothes to improve her business.

loan.use: To buy more food items and clothes to improve her business.

loan.name: Zuhuru

texts.en:
Zuhuru M., age 45, is married with 4 children. She has run a stationery shop since 2002, which is open daily from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $217.

Zuhuru has taken 1 loan before from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the loan to start a second business of selling handbags, sandals, and suits door to door. She paid the loan back successfully and is earning around $174 to $260 a month from this business. With the loan she hopes to receive now, she plans to expand her stationery business.

loan.use: To expand her stationery supply

loan.name: Mbugo

texts.en:
Mbugo H. S. is 38 years old and divorced; she has one 18-year-old child. She has been selling porridge and bites since 2002. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Mbugo now seeking for a loan to improve her business.

loan.use: To improve her business.

loan.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam A. is 31 years old and single. She has been a stationary owner and clothes seller since 2001. Every day, she works from 7am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Maryam is now seeking a loan to buy more stationary items and clothing inventory in order to improve her business.

loan.use: To buy more stationary items and clothes in order to impove her business.

loan.name: Fatma

texts.fr: FatmaW. est une Femme mre de trois enfants qui habite au quartier des parcelles assainies de this. elle gre un restaurant au quarter Randoulene de this depuis plus de dix ans. elle est societaire de l'IMCEC depuis 2003 et a bnfici de plusieurs prets qu'elle a rembours sans problme.. elle sollicite ce nouveau pret dans le but de mieux dvelopper son activit.
texts.en:
Fatma W. is the mother of three children and lives in the district called Parcelles Assainies in This. She has managed a little restaurant in the neighborhood called Randoulene in This for more than 10 years. She has belonged to IMCEC since 2003 and has had several loans that she reimbursed without problems. She is asking for this new loan in order to further develop her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: developing her little restaurant business

loan.name: Evodi

texts.en:
Evodi T. is 34 years old and married. Although he does not yet have any kids of his own, he cares for his sister's 15-year-old son because she is unable to financially support him. Evodi owns a general store where he sells food, toiletries, clothing, and household items. He opened the shop in 2005 and operates daily from 6am to 10pm. He is able to earn a monthly profit of about US$ 261-348.

Evodi has previously taken 4 loans from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used all of the loans to increase the stock of his shop and has paid the loans back successfully. He now hopes to receive a new loan to continue to increase the stock of his general store.

loan.use: Increase stock of general store

loan.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married. She owns a small business in the town of Vinogradovo, Western Ukraine. It is a small store selling clothing items. There's no high competition in the area where she works. The favorable location coupled with financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine have been the factors that impacted growth of her business.

Oksana likes to work in the sphere of trade. She has been working in it for three years during which she faced different challenges such as shaky sale trends, bad timing and other vagaries that can afflict a startup. A combination of core commercial skills, creative enthusiasm and determination to succeed have been her motivating factors.

Oksana would like to get a loan of 5000 Grivnas ($US1,075) which she believes would help her not only sustain her business but also promote its significant growth.

loan.use: To increase range of inventory in her clothing store.

loan.name: Leilah

texts.en:
Leilah M., age 49, is a widow with 7 children. She currently has 2 businesses: a shop where she sells food and other household items, and she owns a dalla-dalla (a public bus). She started these businesses in 2007 and 2005, respectively. Before starting these businesses, Leilah was a housewife and took care of her children. Her shop is open daily from 6:00 AM to 10:00 PM, and she is able to earn a monthly profit of about $130, while she earns about $261 per month from the dalla-dalla.

Leilah has previously taken 4 loans from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used these loans to start her small shop and to later increase the stock in the shop. Now that she has paid back these loans successfully, she is hoping to receive another loan to continue to increase the supplies in her shop.

loan.use: To increase stock in her general store

loan.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana lives in Kherson. After finishing school she was unable to find a good paying job in her field of training so she decided to start her own business selling women's clothing. She has been in business now for 12 years. Trendy clothes and her natural friendliness have helped her business be successful.

Tatyana is very cheerful and resolute. Her main goal is to provide a level of customer friendly service that exceeds her clients' expectations, creates repeat customers and attracts new customers to her kiosk. Her entrepreneurial talent and hard work in combination with 18 loans from Nadiya Ukraine have helped promote the dynamic growth of her business.

Tatyana would like to purchase additional inventory. This loan for 3000 Grivnas ($US650) will allow her to fulfill her goal and will increase her working capital. Successful, stable growth in Tatyana's business will help provide a more secure future for her venture and family.

Note: This is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loan.use: To purchase additional inventory for her clothing store.

loan.name: Aida

texts.fr: Aida N. est une femme age de 59 ans .elle est marie et habite au quartier Cit Lamy de this .elle fait du commerce de denres alimentaires et quelque fois des tissus depuis vingt ans elle sollicite ce pret pour le renforcement de ses activits.
texts.en:
Aida N., 59, is married and lives in the Cit Lamy neighborhood in This. She has been selling foodstuffs and sometimes cloth for 20 years. She is asking for this loan to bolster her little businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: sale of foodstuffs

loan.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is an entrepreneur from Kherson where she sells knitted wear for children in the local Dneprovskyi market. Tatyana is a married mom of two kids, seven and five years old. She manages to balance family and work, effectively managing her time with wisdom and thorough planning. Tatyana has been in this trade for two years. Presently, she has about $2000 invested in her business. Her net profit amounts to $400 a month.

Tatyana is a true venturer. She takes risks and handles challenges with endurance and perseverance. Tatyana pursues success of her business and seeks to see it flourish and thrive. This time Tatyana is requesting a loan of 5000 Grivnas ($US1,075) to re-stock her inventory and generate additional income.

loan.use: To re-stock inventory in her clothing shop.

loan.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is an entrepreneur from Simferopol. She lives there with her husband and a four-year-old son. Marina sells discount men's and women's clothing wholesale. All merchandise she offers for sale in her business is trademark quality at affordable prices. When Marina launched her enterprise nine years ago it was pretty frugal. However, she was consistently increasing her clientele and assortment of trendy discount clothing imported from other countries. Currently, Marina has about $2000 in inventory. Her net profit is about $400 a month.

Marina is seeking a 3000 Grivna ($US650) loan to add to her stock and meet the growing demand for discount clothing stores in Simferopol. At this point one of her business goals is to find reliable and accountable suppliers to partner with. Marina has already repaid six loans to Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies. We believe her outstanding credit history and willingness to strive for higher goals will help her repay the current loan and reach success in her business.

Note: This is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loan.use: To purchase clothing stock wholesale.

loan.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Aissatou D. est une femme marie age de 58 ans qui habite la cit Lamy.depuis plus de dix ans elle s'active dans le commerce de poissons secs, pate d'arachide, huile de palme etc... Elle sollicite ce pret pour renforcer son captital.
texts.en:
Aissatou D., 58, is married and lives in the Cit Lamy neighborhood. For more than 10 years, she has been selling dried fish, peanut butter, palm oil, etc.

She is requesting this loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: sale of peanut butter and palm oil

loan.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. is 52 years old and is divorced with two grown children. She runs a small grocery store and also sells poultry. She started these businesses in 1996 and works daily from 7am to 10pm, sometimes staying open until midnight on the weekends. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $261-348.

This will be Josephine's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She is very excited for this opportunity and intends to use the loan to increase the inventory of her grocery store.

loan.use: To increase the inventory of her grocery store.

loan.name: Mame Anta

texts.fr: Mame Anta N. est une femme marie age de 27 ans.elle habite la cit lamy de this et gre une boutique depuis deux ans. elle sollicite ce pret pour le renforcement de sa boutique d'alimentation gnrale.
texts.en:
Mame Anta N. is a married 27-year-old woman. She lives in the Cit Lamy district of This and has been managing a shop for two years. She is requesting this loan to bolster her shop selling food items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To bolster her shop

loan.name: Sharifa's Fahari Yetu Group

texts.en:
Sharifa H., age 34, is divorced with 2 children, ages 14 and 10. She opened a shop 3 years ago in an area called Mabibo, where she sells cloth, toiletries, cosmetics, and small fish. She works daily from 7:00 AM to 9:00 PM and also has a long commute to her home in Tabata. She earns about $217 per month from her shop.

Sharifa has previously taken 1 loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the loan to start selling the small fish in her shop. She paid back the first loan successfully and is now hoping to receive another loan to open a second shop closer to her home.

Sharifa is part of a subgroup of Fahari Yetu (meaning "our pride" in Swahili). The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Sharifa is second from the left. On her left is Juma (a shop owner), to her right is Mwajuma (clothing sales), Sauda (a salon owner) is second from the right, and Mariam (clothing sales) is on the right.

loan.use: To open a second cosmetics shop in Tabata

loan.name: Felipa

texts.es: En una comunidad de la ciudad de Puno, llamada, Pirullo, tiene su vivienda Felipa de 33 aos de edad, es madre de 2 pequeos nios, quienes se han convertido en su motor de vida; desde que form su familia, hace ms de 12 aos, se dedic a la crianza y alimentacin de terneros y cerdos, luego de que sus animales tiene un peso y tamao adecuado, los vende, con los beneficios econmicos que obtiene, incrementa el dinero que su esposo Melecio, como profesor lleva a su hogar, as cubren juntos, los gastos de su familia.Estos padres, tienen pensado comprar dos terneros, que en adelante, con cuidado y alimentacin, les provean de leche, y as, poco a poco dedicarse a la elaboracin de deliciosos quesos.Con ese propsito, Felipa, solicita este prstamo.
texts.en:
In a neighborhood of Puno city, called Pirullo, lives 33 year old Felipa, mother of 2 small children who are the driving force of her life. Ever since she had her family, for more than 12 years, she has dedicated herself to raising and feeding calves and pigs. Then, when her animals are of an adequate weight and size, she sells them, and the income she receives compliments the money that her husband Melecio earns as a teacher. Together they cover their family's expenses. These parents are planning to buy two calves, that in the future, with care and feeding, will provide milk, and in this way, little by little they can begin making delicious cheese. With this proposition, Felipa is asking for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy two calves to feed and care for, to produce milk and cheese

loan.name: Anta

texts.fr: Anta S. est une femme marie age de 25 ans.elle habite au quartier Grand Thies et fait du commerce , greffages, mches depuis trois ans. elle s'aprovisionne des grossistes du march central de thies pour ensuite les revendre dans son quartier
texts.en:
Anta S., age 25, is married, and she lives in the neighborhood called Grand Thies. Anta has been selling cloth and various sorts of hair extensions for 3 years. She is requesting this loan so as to better prepare for the Muslim holiday locally known as Korit.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: vente de greffage

loan.name: Felipa

texts.es: Encontramos a Felipa pastando muy contenta, a sus vaquitas, es madre de 4 hijos, desde que su esposo falleci, hace ms de 10 aos, qued sola a cargo de sus pequeos nios.Como toda madre, preocupada por el bienestar de sus hijos, busc la manera de generar ingresos extras para el sustento de su familia, desde entonces se dedica a la ganadera, con esta labor trata de dar lo mejor de s, con el fin de que los animales que cra, reciban una buena alimentacin y cuidado, correspondiendo a esto, con la produccin de leche.Para aumentar sus ingresos econmicos, tiene pensado comprar otra ternera, para ello requiere un prstamo de 2 mil soles, dinero que se compromete en rembolsar en un lapso de 7 meses.
texts.en:
We find Felipa very content with her grazing little cows. She is the mother of 4 children. Since her husband died, 10 years ago, she was left alone to care for her small children. Like all mothers, worried about the well-being of her children, she looked for a way to generate extra income to support her family. Since then she has worked with cattle, and with this work she does her best, with the outcome that the animals she raises receive good food and care, and along with this milk production. In order to increase her earnings, she is planning to buy another calf so she needs a loan of 2000 soles, money that she promises to repay in 7 months.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy another calf and increase her cattle.

loan.name: Antonio

texts.es: Encontramos a Antonio en su vivienda elaborando muy contento sus deliciosos quesos; durante muchos aos atrs este laborioso padre estaba dedicado al comercio de ganado, pero desdichadamente no le fue muy bien; al ver que su esposa enferm y sus hijos deseaban seguir estudios superiores, se vio en la necesidad de buscar y generar sus propios ingresos econmicos. Antonio inici vendiendo quesos que adquira en su pueblo, Cupi, pero su inquietud e iniciativa le llevaron a elaborar sus propios productos, ahora este ejemplar padre y esposo recopila diariamente alrededor de 200 litros de leche de sus vecinos ganaderos, con esta cantidad de leche realiza alrededor de 30 quesos, que luego de cada fin de semana lo vende al por mayor en las ciudades de Puno, Cuzco y Arequipa.Este oficio le permite cubrir con los gastos de salud de su esposa Narcisa y los gastos de sus 3 hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la ciudad de Arequipa.El deseo que tiene Antonio es comprar una prensadora para quesos, esta herramienta le permitir agilizar su trabajo, por lo que solicita este prstamo.
texts.en:
We meet Antonio in his home, happily preparing his delicious cheeses; for many years this diligent father made his living in livestock. Unfortunately things did not go well for him--his wife became ill and his children wanted to pursue upper-level studies, so it became necessary for him to find and generate his own income. Antonio started selling cheeses that he bought in his town of Cupi, but his worry and initiative drove him to produce his own products. Now this exemplary father and husband daily collects about 200 liters of milk from his stockbreeding neighbors, from which he makes about 30 cheeses. Then every weekend he sells them wholesale in the cities of Puno, Cuzco and Arequipa. This trade allows him to take care of the health expenses of his wife Narcisa and the expenses of his 3 children who are studying in the city of Arequipa. Antonio's wish is to buy a cheese press, which would allow him to speed up his work--this is why he is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy a cheese press to speed up his work.

loan.name: Juan

texts.es: Jorge, Jorgito, como lo suelen llamar sus vecinos y amigos es un joven emprendedor y muy hacendoso, desde pequeo demostr ser un muchacho con mucha fuerza de voluntad y trabajador, por ello, desde adolescente se dedic a trabajar en una pequea carpintera, gracias a su iniciativa y agilidad aprendi rpidamente el oficio, actualmente con mucho esfuerzo y constancia est logrando implementar su propio taller, instalado en el domicilio de sus padres, gracias los novedosos y finos acabados de sus trabajos, su clientela se siente muy contenta y satisfecha. En esta oportunidad, para seguir desenvolvindose y poniendo en cada uno de sus finos proyectos, gran creatividad desea adquirir algunas herramientas de trabajo, y con ese fin, es que solicita este prstamo.
texts.en:
Jorge, or "Jorgito", as his friends and neighbors call him, is a hardworking, enterprising young man. Ever since he was young, he showed himself to be a strong-willed, hardworking boy. In his adolescence, he began working in a small carpentry workshop. Thanks to his initiative and agility, he learned the trade very quickly, and he is currently putting together a carpentry workshop of his own at his parents' house. Thanks to his novel, finely crafted pieces, his clients have been very happy and satisfied with his work. In order to continue his highly creative work and further the development of his business, Jorgito is requesting this loan so that he can buy more tools to use in his work.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy carpentry tools

loan.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth es una muchacha tierna, alegre y dedicada a su trabajo, no pudo concluir sus estudios secundarios, porque al nacer sufri un accidente que le impide desenvolverse eficientemente en los estudios, desde entonces la vida cambi para ella, porque a partir de ese accidente tuvo que estar en constante tratamiento medico.Actualmente vive con su madre, quien es su nica compaa, con quien tambin comparte su negocio de venta de golosinas y gaseosas, con las ganancias que obtiene en este negocio puede comprar sus medicamentos, pero eso no es suficiente para cubrir todos sus gastos.En estos momentos, Ruth y su madre desean aumentar y ampliar su negocio, por ese motivo solicita el presente prstamo, dinero que ser rembolsado en un lapso de 6 meses.
texts.en:
Ruth is a sweet, cheerful girl, who is dedicated to her work. She was not able to finish her high school studies due to having suffered complications at birth that impeded her scholastic development. Due to these complications, she has had to be under continual medical care since she was born. Ruth lives with her mother, who is her only company. She and her mother share a business of selling snacks and soft drinks. With the earnings from the business, Ruth is able to purchase her medications; however, this is insufficient to cover all of her costs. At this time, Ruth and her mother want to expand and increase their business, which is why Ruth is requesting a loan. The loan proceeds will be repaid within a 6-month period.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Increase and expand selection of merchandise.

loan.name: Silvia

texts.es: Las aspiraciones de Silvia, desde que form su familia, fueron de brindarles amor, bienestar y tranquilidad a sus 2 hijos, esta joven madre, desde hace 6 aos est dedicada a la comercializacin de golosinas en forma ambulatoria, al ver que sus ganancias y los ingresos que su esposo obtena con su trabajo de mototaxista no cubran todos los gastos familiares, decidi buscar la manera de generar ingresos extras, por ello, actualmente se dedica a la venta de productos cosmticos y utensilios de cocina, con estas actividades y el esfuerzo de su esposo, estn supliendo las necesidades de su hogar.Pero, para seguir creciendo y poder ofrecerles a sus hijos una mejor educacin, solicita este prstamo, para incrementar sus productos y as aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Silvia's aspirations, since she began her family, were to bring love, well-being and tranquility to her two children. She is a young mother. For six years, she has been engaged in travelling snack sales. Upon seeing that her earnings and her husband's income as a taxi driver were not covering all of their regular expenses, she decided to seek a means of earning extra income. In this way, she began selling cosmetic products and kitchen utensils. With these activities and her husband's efforts, they are meeting their household needs. However, she is requesting a loan to keep growing her business and to be able to offer a better education to her children. The loan will be used to increase her product inventory and thereby increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To increase product inventory.

loan.name: Fatou Kine

texts.fr: Fatou Kin S. est une femme marie age de 42 ans.elle habite au quartier Cit Lamy et fait du commerce de depoissons secs, d'huile de palme etc ..depuis cinq ans. elles sollicite ce pret dans le but de renforcer son capital .
texts.en:
Fatou Kin S. is a married 42-year-old woman. She lives in the Cit Lamy district and has been doing commerce in dried fish, palm oil, etc. for five years. She is requesting this loan with the goal of bolstering her capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To sell food items

loan.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana es una responsable madre, desde nia tuvo un don especial para la cocina, gracias a eso, actualmente prepara sabrossimos guisos, y complace satisfactoriamente el paladar de sus asiduos comensales.Inici trabajando como cocinera en un reconocido restaurante de la ciudad de Juliaca, luego de formar su familia, decidi abrir su propio restaurante en el pueblito de Ananea, lugar donde radica con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, quienes la apoyan complacientemente en su actividad.En esta oportunidad, viendo la solicitud de sus clientes, se vio en la necesidad de aumentar la cantidad y variedad de platos, con el fin de complacer a toda y cada uno de sus comensalesEs por esa razn, solicita este prstamo, dinero que invertir en adquirir insumos para la preparacin de sus agradables platillos.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a responsible mother. Since she was a girl, she had a special gift in the kitchen. Thanks to this talent, she has the ability to prepare delicious stews that satisfy the palates of her table companions. Maximiliana began working as a cook at a well known restaurant in the city of Juliaca. After starting her family, she decided to open her own restaurant in the little village of Ananea, where she lives with her husband and four children, all of whom obligingly help her with her work. At the urging of her customers, she saw the need to increase the quantity and variety of dishes, with the goal of satisfying each and every one of her guests. She is requesting a loan for this reason. The loan proceeds will be invested in acquiring ingredients for the preparation of her palatable dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Ingredients for the preparation of various dishes.

loan.name: Juliana

texts.es: Julia es una amorosa ama de casa y gran colaboradora en el taller de carpintera de su esposo Alfredo, ambos se esfuerzan y ponen lo mejor de s para que cada uno de los trabajos que realizan quede del agrado de su exigente clientela.Esta pareja inicia su labor cotidiana a las 7:00 de la maana y termina a las 6:00 de la tarde, fabrican muebles bajo pedido, elaborando para proveer a diferentes muebleras de su ciudad, Juliaca, gracias a este oficio estn logrando afrontar satisfactoriamente todos sus gastos familiares.En esta oportunidad, debido a la gran cantidad de solicitudes, requieren obtener variedad de madera y barniz, con el cual le dan el acabado final a cada una de las piezas que elaboran, por esa razn, Julia presenta esta solicitud de prstamos, dinero que lo invertirn en adquirir materiales de trabajo para seguir elaborando sus muebles.
texts.en:
Julia is a loving housewife and great assistant to Alfredo, her husband, in his carpenter's shop. Both Alfredo and Julia expend all of their energy to insure that each of their projects fully meet the desires of their demanding clientele. The pair begins their labors each day at 7:00 AM and end the day at 6:00 PM. They build and finish furniture by direct order and to stock local furniture dealers in the city. Thanks to their business the pair is fully capable of covering household expenses. Alfredo and Julia have recently received a large quantity of orders, which will require various types of wood and varnish in order to complete. Julia is requesting a loan which will be used to purchase the necessary materials for the preparation and completion of the existing orders.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of wood, varnish and other finishing products.

loan.name: Penda

texts.fr: Penda S. est une femme veuve age de trente deux ans.elle habite la cit lamy et fait du commerce de tissus, draps etc depuis cinq ans
texts.en:
Penda S. is a 32-year-old widow. She lives in Cit Lamy and has been doing commerce in fabrics, sheets, etc. for five years.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Vente de draps

loan.name: Marcela

texts.es: Pese a su avanzada, Marcela trabaja tenazmente para seguir desenvolvindose en su actividad D. venta D. productos andinos, que durante muchos aos le ha dado enormes satisfacciones.Esta laboriosa madre, desD. hace 28 aos est dedicada a la venta D. papa, cebada, chuo, quinua, etc. dentro del mercado Cerro Colorado D. la ciudad D. Juliaca, desD. que su esposo falleci vive sola con sus 2 hijos y sus nietitos, por quienes siente un gran amor, alegra.El motivo por el que solicita este prstamo, es incrementar la cantidad D. sus productos, para as obtener mejores ganancias y poder apoyar a sus nietos en su educacin.
texts.en:
Despite her advanced age, Marcela works tenaciously to get ahead in her business selling Andean products. This job has given her enormous satisfaction for many years. For 28 years, this laborious mother has dedicated herself to the sale of potatoes, barley, chuo and quinoa in the Cerro Colorado market in the city of Juliaca. Since her husband passed away she lives alone with her two children and her grandchildren whom she loves dearly. She is seeking this loan to increase the quantity of her products in order to obtain greater profits and be able to support her grandchildren in their education.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Increase the quantity of products.

loan.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Dentro del mercado Cerro Colorado de la ciudad de Juliaca, seccin pescados, encontramos a Beatriz, madre alegre, dedicada y muy emprendedora, con muchas ganas de seguir adelante y ofrecerles bienestar, seguridad y tranquilidad a sus hijos.Desde hace 12 aos est dedicada a la comercializacin de pescado, gracias a este negocio, su empeo y diligencia logrado brindar educacin y mantener sin limitacin a sus 3 hijos, por lo que se siente muy orgullosa y contenta.Actualmente, el deseo de Beatriz es comprar otro puesto de venta dentro del mercado, pretende ampliar su negocio y seguir creciendo, motivo de su solicitud de prstamo.
texts.en:
Entering the fish sellers section within the large Colorado Hill market of the beautiful city Juliaca we find Beatriz. Beatriz is a happy mother of great entrepreneurial sprirt, fortified by dedication, with a pervasive desire to get ahead and provide for the well-being of her children. Beatriz has sold fish for twelve years. The business has provide well for her and thanks to her diligent effort she has been able to provide for and educate her three children. Beatriz is incredibly proud of her children. Currently, Beatriz wishes to purchase an additional stall within the market in order to expand her business and continue growing in the industry. For this reason Beatiz is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of an additional stall within the market.

loan.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, a sus 21 aos es propietaria de un pequeo taller de fabricacin de muebles, viene forjando este negocio con su esposo, con quien hace poco tiempo decidi unirse, con muchas ilusiones de formar un hogar donde reine el amor y tranquilidad.Esta joven pareja se complementan tambin en el trabajo, mientras l se dedica a la fabricacin de variedad y hermosos muebles, Nelly se encarga de captar los pedidos y distribuir los productos finales.Con el dinero que solicita Nelly, desean implementarse con todas las herramientas de trabajo para su pequeo taller, con esa perspectiva se esfuerzan diligentemente poniendo en cada uno de sus trabajos su mejor esfuerzo, creatividad y un buen servicio.
texts.en:
At 21 years of age, Nelly is the owner of a small furniture making shop. She established this business with her husband who she recently decided to join in marriage. They have dreams of building a home where love and tranquility reign. This young couple also compliment themselves in their work. While her husband dedicates himself to manufacturing the beautiful furniture, Nelly is in charge of receiving orders and distributing the finished products. With the loan that Nelly is requesting, they want to furnish their shop with all the necessary tools. With this in mind, they work diligently putting their best efforts, creativity and service in each of their jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase necessary tools for furniture making shop.

loan.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une femme marie age de 52 ans.elle fait du petit commerce de tissus, parfums,huile de palme etc depuis quinze ans
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou D. is 52 years old and married. She has kept up a small business selling fabrics, perfumes palm oil etc for fifteen years.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Sale of fabrics

loan.name: Elva

texts.es: Su pequea, pero surtida tienda de abarrotes es el ms importante ingreso econmico con el que cuenta Elva y su pequea nia Nadia de 12 aos de edad, desde siempre fue una mujer muy luchadora que cada da pone lo mejor de s para sacar adelante su negocio y a su querida hija.Ambas, actualmente viven en uno de los barrios ms lejanos de la ciudad de Juliaca, lugar donde instalaron su bodega, anteriormente esta localidad careca de una tienda donde ofrecen gran cantidad y variedad de productos de primera necesidad, pero ahora gracias a la iniciativa y buena atencin, est complaciendo satisfactoriamente a sus clientes, y la demanda de su negocio va en aumento.Elva tiene planeado ampliar su tienda; para continuar con su meta trazada, solicita el presente prstamo.
texts.en:
Her small but well stocked grocery store is the most important economic source of income that Elva and her small 12 year old daughter Nadia count on. Elva has always been a strong-willed woman who every day puts her best forward to make her business successful and take care of her daughter. Together they live in one of the most distant neighborhoods of Juliaca, and this is where they put their store. Previously this location didn't have a store where a large quantity and variety of basic needs products were available, put now thanks to this initiative and good service, Elva is meeting her customer's needs and the demand for her business is growing. Elva has plans to expand her store, to continue with her goal she is asking for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Expand and improve her grocery store

loan.name: Jackeline

texts.es: Jackeline es una muchacha de 18 aos de edad, desde que concluy sus estudios secundarios, inmediatamente decidi dedicarse a la venta de vajillas de porcelana y variedad de utensilios de cocina, su empeo, alegra e iniciativa la estn llevando a tener xito en su negocio, lo que le permitir cubrir satisfactoriamente sus estudios superiores. Adquiere su mercadera en la ciudad de Lima, y la vende de forma ambulatoria en su ciudad, Juliaca.Por la variedad y novedosas mercaderas que ofrece est logrando obtener buenos beneficios econmicos.Ahora, debido a demanda de sus clientes desea aumentar el monto de su capital, es por esa razn que solicita este prstamo, dinero que tiene pensado invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Jackeline is a young 18-year-old woman. Ever since she completed her high school studies, she immediately decided to sell porcelain dinnerware and a variety of kitchen utensils for a living. Her dedication, delight, and initiative have caused her to be prosperous in her business, which will allow her to adequately cover her university studies. She obtains her merchandise in the city of Lima, then sells it as a street vendor in her city, Juliaca. Because of the variety and the innovative products that she offers, she has managed to obtain good profits. Now, due to customer demand, she would like to increase her capital, which is why she is requesting this loan that will be invested in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Increase inventory

loan.name: Mary Nambalirwa's Group

texts.en:
Mary is a leader of 5 members of a group. She is a 44-year-old married woman with 4 children, aged between 20 and 5. All of her children go to school. She resides in and owns a 2-room house, where she is staying with 4 of her husband's children. There are 6 people who live there.

The family gets 3 meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Mary works in Owino market, one of the city suburbs, and deals in second-hand clothes. She sells to an average of 10 people a day and works 6 days a week. Mary's monthly expenses include school fees and rent. She has been in this business for 6 years. She used to operate a beauty salon but had to change to second-hand clothes due to the high demand for them and their profitability.

Mary's main challenges are seasonality and the rainy season, which makes storage facilities difficult. She has been with MCDT for 6 years and is servicing her eleventh loan, working all this long time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to increase stock in her business. .

loan.use: To increase stock in her business

loan.name: Khar

texts.fr: Khar F. est une femme marie age de 39 ans.elle habite au quartier cite lamy et vend du petit djeuner depuis dix ans.
texts.en:
Khar F. is a married 39-year-old woman. She lives in the Cit Lamy district and has been selling breakfasts for 10 years.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To sell breakfasts

loan.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Eusebia siempre demostr tener gran creatividad y habilidad en sus manos, por ello, desde nia so ser una gran cosmetloga y tener un reconocido saln de belleza, hoy sigue mostrando mucha pasin y diligencia por esta actividad, su clientela se siente muy satisfecha y contenta con su trabajo.Ella es natural del pueblito de Ananea, apenas concluy sus estudios secundarios parti a la ciudad de Juliaca, donde estudi cosmetologa, (nos muestra su certificado en la foto) actualmente va implementando con mucho esfuerzo su pequeo saln de belleza, ubicado en su pueblo. Su deseo es terminar de implementar su saln, con el fin de brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela, es por recurre a este prstamo, con la promesa de ser puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Eusebia always demonstrated having great creativity and skill with her hands. Ever since she was a girl she dreamed of being a great cosmetologist and have a renown beauty salon. Today she continues demonstrating a lot of passion and diligence for this profession. Her customers feel very satisfied and content with her work. She was born in Ananea, and just after completing high school she left for the city of Juliaca, where she studied cosmetology (she shows us her certification in the photograph). Today with great effort she is sett up her small beauty salon located in her town. Her wish is to finish setting up her salon, with the goal of providing a better service to her customers, so she is asking for this loan with the promise of being punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Continue implementing her beauty salon

loan.name: Abigail

texts.es: Sus bajos recursos econmicos y problemas personales nunca derrotaron Abigail, joven perseverante de 28 aos, desde adolescente busc innumerables formas de generar sus propios ingresos econmicos, as poco a poco independizarse y apoyar a sus padres en la educacin de sus hermanos menores.Luego de tentar suerte con varios negocios, decidi dedicarse ntegramente a la comercializacin de prendas usadas, esta actividad le est permitiendo acabar con sus obstculos econmicos, y al mismo tiempo ayudar a sus padres en la educacin y alimentacin de sus hermanos menores.En estos momentos tiene grandes anhelos que la motivan a seguir adelante, pero requiere del prstamo que solicita para cumplirlos, vender ms y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Scarce economic resources and personal problems have never gotten the better of Abigail, a persevering 28-year-old woman. Ever since she was a teenager, she has found innumerable ways to generate her own income, and bit by bit has been able to become independent. She even helps her parents pay for her younger siblings' education. After trying her luck with several different businesses, Abigail decided to fully dedicate herself to selling used clothing, and this activity has helped her overcome economic obstacles and help her parents educate and feed her younger brothers and sisters. Today, Abigail has great dreams that compel her to continue to strive, but she needs the loan she is requesting to fulfill these dreams by selling more and increasing her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase used clothing to sell

loan.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria es una humilD. y cariosa madre, desD. muy nia estuvo dedicada a la venta D. pescado dentro del mercado Cerro Colorado D. la ciudad D. Juliaca, oficio que aprendi D. sus padres; gracias a esta labor y al trabajo D. su esposo es que pudieron brindarles educacin a sus hijos.Ahora, viendo a sus hijos ya mayores e independientes con sus propias familias se siente realizada como madre, pero al mismo tiempo, sola y triste por la penosa prdida D. su compaero D. toda su vida, su esposo.Actualmente, encontr en su negocio y sus compaeros D. trabajo la nica forma D. distraerse y olvidar los momentos difciles que le toc pasar, por ello, decidi dedicarse ntegramente a su negocio y para ello tiene pensado aumentar el monto D. su capital, para concretar sus planes hace la presente solicitud D. prstamo.
texts.en:
Victoria is a humble and loving mother. Since she was very young she maD. a living selling fish at the Cerro Colorado Market in the city of Juliaca, a traD. she learned from her parents. Thanks to this work and her husband's job, they have been able to proviD. for the children's education. Now, seeing that her kids are grown up and have their own families, she feels like her job has been completed as a mother, but at the same time feels sad and alone after losing her husband, her lifelong partner. Currently she stays busy with her business and her co-workers are her only form of distraction and forget the difficult times that have passed. So she decided to grow her business and for that, she's been planning on raising more capital. She's requesting a loan to help her carry out her plan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Increase capital for fish-selling business

loan.name: Valeria

texts.es: Ordenando su mercadera, encontramos a Valeria, de 55 aos, madre preocupa, responsable y trabajadora, desde hace 25 aos est dedicada a la venta de prendas de vestir tales como: calcetines, escarpines, pantalones para nios, caballeros y damas, mercadera que ofrece los das de feria en los distintos pueblitos aledaos a su ciudad natal, Juliaca.Mientras Valeria se dedica a esta actividad, su esposo trata de sacar adelante su carpintera, entre ambos buscan mejorar su calidad de vida, pero el ingreso que obtienen aun no suple completamente sus gastos familiares, por ello, Valeria desea aumentar y ampliar su negocio, considera que haciendo estas modificaciones podra obtener mayores beneficios econmicos, con ese fin solicita este prstamo, dinero que se compromete en retornarlo en un lapso de 6 meses.
texts.en:
Straightening up her inventory, we find Valeria, a 55-year-old responsible, hard-working and concerned mother. For the last 25 years she's made a living selling clothes such as socks, slippers and pants for all ages and sexes, merchandise she offers on markets days in the distinctive towns surrounding her native city, Juliaca. While Valeria dedicates herself to this endeavor, her husband tries to make headway with his carpentry business. Together they work to improve their quality of life, but the money they make sill doesn't cover household expenses. Valeria wants to grow and expand her business, which would help her increase her earnings. With this goal, she's requesting a loan, which she plans to repay within six months.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Expand business and increase inventory

loan.name: Pedro

texts.es: Alejandro es un muchacho de 24 aos, desde adolescente se dedica al trabajo de electricista, labor que aprendi en el colegio tcnico industrial en el que estudiaba su nivel secundario, gracias a su iniciativa y perseverancia pudo perfeccionar sus conocimientos, con los que ahora se desenvuelve eficientemente, por lo que sus servicios son muy solicitados en su pueblo, Santa Rosa.Adicionalmente, en sus horas libres se dedica a la compra y venta de carros, esta actividad le est permitiendo mejorar sus ingresos econmicos y sobre todo apoyar en los gastos de su hogar.Su deseo es aumentar el monto de inversin de su negocio, con ese objetivo solicita el presente prstamo.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 24 years old and since adolescence has made a living as an electrician, a trade he learned at a technical school when he was in high school. Thanks to his initiative and perseverance he was able to fine-tune his skills, which have developed to the point that his services are highly requested in his town of Santa Rosa. Additionally, in his free time he dedicates himself to buying and selling cars, which helps increase his finances and, more importantly, helps pay household expenses. He wishes to increase his working capital, which is why he's requesting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Increase working capital for business endeavors (electrician and buying and selling cars)

loan.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Maimouna D. est une femme marie age de 58 ans.elle habite au quartier cit lamy.elle s'active dans le commerce de denres alimentaires depuis dix ans.
texts.en:
Maimouna D. is a married 58-year-old woman. She lives in the Cit Lamy district. She has been very active doing commerce in food items for ten years.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To sell food items

loan.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata W. est une femme veuve age de 56 ans. elle habite la cit Senghor et s'active dans le commerce de tissus depuis cinq ans.
texts.en:
Aminata W. is a widow aged 56. She lives in the Senghor development and has been selling cloth for 5 years.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: sale of cloth

loan.name: Aurora

texts.es: Aurora es una diligente madre de 34 aos de edad, junto a su esposo tratan de poner su mayor empeo con el fin de sacar adelante a sus hijos y brindarles la educacin que se merecen.Hace 13 aos radican en la ciudad de Juliaca, desde que viven en esta ciudad, con mucho empeo y dedicacin logr implementar su puesto de venta de verduras, en una de las calles ms concurridas de su ciudad.Gracias a su alegra y clida atencin que brinda ha logrado conseguir clientes fieles, actualmente su negocio y la labor de su esposo, como chofer, les est permitiendo mejorar su calidad de vida.Con el dinero que solicita, Aurora, desea ampliar su negocio y obtener mayores beneficios.
texts.en:
Aurora is a diligent 34 year old mother. Together with her husband they work very hard to give their children a head start in life and provide them the education they deserve. Thirteen years ago they settled in the city of Juliaca. Since living in this city, through hard work and dedication, she managed to open her own produce stand in one of the busiest streets of the city. Thanks to the warmth and attentiveness she offers, she has acquired many loyal customers. Her business and her husband's job as a chauffer has allowed them to improve their quality of life. With this loan request, Aurora hopes to expand her business and increase benefits.

Translated from Spanish by Liz West, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: An influx of capital for her produce selling business.

loan.name: Juliet Kanakulya's Group

texts.en:
Juliet K. is 38 years old and divorced with two children, aged twenty and twelve years old. Both of her children are in school. Juliet lives in a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

For the past eight years, Juliet has been selling charcoal.
